title: Installation Team Crew Leader
description:
Salary: $27 per hour + Performance and Efficiency Incentives  
Job Type: Full-time

Since 1999, Triple H Insulation has been providing Nassau & Suffolk County homeowners with the most comprehensive energy-saving services with the utmost integrity and professionalism. As a woman-owned company, we are committed to treating everyone with equal respect and focusing on direct communication with all the household decision-makers, so each person is engaged in the process. Our skilled energy experts use building science to help our clients save on their energy usage, reducing their energy costs and improving their home or office comfort. We hold a Gold Star Home Performance Contractor designation from the Building Performance Institute (BPI) and each member of our technical staff is individually BPI certified as energy auditors and building envelope professionals. We won Best Insulation Company on Long Island in 2023 and 2024 by Bethpage Best of Long Island.

We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Crew Lead / Foreman to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills, the ability to clearly delegate responsibilities on the job site, and exceptional customer service and communication abilities.

Responsibilities:

* Introduce yourself and your team to homeowners and clearly explain the scope of work before starting the project. Address any concerns or questions they may have.
* Lead and manage a crew on residential insulation projects.
* Delegate tasks effectively to ensure timely and efficient project completion.
* Maintain high standards of safety and quality on all job sites.
* Ensure compliance with company policies and health and safety standards.
* Conduct walkthroughs with the homeowner twice per day: midday and before leaving the job site.
* Prepare project documentation and reporting.
* Keep the work truck neat and organized to ensure efficiency and safety.
* Inspect and manage construction supplies and tools.
* Maintain accurate records of work progress.
* Train, cross-train, evaluate, and develop team members. QA each crew member for attention to detail and workmanship quality.
* Perform labor alongside the crew, ensuring the project is completed to the highest standards.
* Ensure the house is left in a clean condition and clean up properly before leaving for the day.
* Ensure all necessary before and after photos are taken.
* Collect payment from the customer.

Requirements:

* Proven experience in residential construction (insulation experience preferred).
* Strong leadership and delegation skills.
* Excellent customer service and communication skills.
* Knowledge of OSHA safety regulations.
* Ability to work in various weather conditions and physical environments.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation – ability to drive a 14–16-foot box truck preferred.
* Ability to exercise problem-solving skills and think outside the box. Contact others for alternative solutions if needed.

Benefits:

* Competitive hourly rate of $27 per hour.
* Performance and efficiency incentives.
* Opportunity to work with a leading company in the insulation industry.
* Access to an unmatched wealth of training resources through Contractor Nation for professional development.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* Medical, dental, vision insurance available, 401(k)

How to Apply: Interested candidates are encouraged to apply with their resume.  
Join us at Triple H Insulation and help us deliver top-quality insulation services to Long Island homeowners!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Work Location: In person

title: Floating Group Home Manager (Bergen & Morris Counties)
description:
\\*\\***\\*OFFERING $1,000 SIGNING BONUS!\\*\\*\\***

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Morris, Bergen, and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

We are actively seeking a **Floating Group Home Manager** for our residential home serving individuals with physical, intellectual, and developmental disabilities in **Bergen & Morris Counties.**

**Requirements:**

* Associate's degree preferred, High School Diploma / GED required.
* 2+ years of group home management experience.
* Knowledge and understanding of the IDD community and services.
* Valid driver's license and willingness to undergo pre-employment requirements.

**Role of a Group Home Manager:**

* Supervise and train all staff to ensure completion of their duties.
* Create and manage the staff schedule.
* Attend to the physical welfare of the individuals served including but not limited to: transporting to medical appointments, administering individual’s medications in accordance with prescription and addressing & reporting accidents, incidents and/or behaviors as needed.
* Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs when necessary.
* Be a contributing member of the IDT and attend ISP meetings.
* Coordinate recreational programs.
* Completion of monthly fire drill reports.
* Oversee the financial running of the home, petty cash, and individual’s Personal Needs Accounts.
* Report and coordinate all maintenance needs.
* Complete individual’s census and attendance records.
* Review Electronic Health System data daily for completion and accuracy.
* Be on call and responsible for handling all emergencies and staffing issues.
* Ensure that the house programs and physical environment provides a safe, enriched, and respectful atmosphere for the consumers in accordance with DDD Licensing Standard and Avidd Community Services of NJ Policies and Procedures.

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

* $1,000 Signing Bonus
* Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.
* Paid Training
* Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays
* Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) and Sick Time
* 403b Retirement Plan with employer contribution

**APPLY TODAY ON INDEED!**

title: Customer Service Representative (Bilingual - Spanish/ English) for new Call Center
description:
**New and Exciting Opportunity: Join Our 24/7 Growing Call Center!**


**About Us:**  

Join a technology company’s team dedicated to providing top-notch customer service in a dynamic and engaging work environment. This company is seeking a motivated and customer service-savvy individual to help their customers overcome their internet-related challenges with confidence and professionalism. **Our call center is expanding, offering exciting new opportunities, and operates 24/7, ideally requiring flexibility to work weekends, evening shifts, and overnights.**  

**Job Summary:**



As a Level 1 Customer Service Representative who is bilingual (Spanish/ English), you will serve as the initial point of contact for customers seeking technical help. Your responsibilities will include troubleshooting problems, offering effective solutions, and ensuring customer satisfaction using tools like Fresh Desk, Sonar, and other advanced platforms.


**Key Responsibilities:**  

**Customer Support:**


* Provide outstanding customer service to users experiencing internet-related technical difficulties.
* Respond quickly and professionally to incoming calls, emails, and support tickets.
* Diagnose and resolve issues related to internet connectivity, service disruptions, and account management.
* Guide customers through step-by-step troubleshooting procedures.


**Ticket Management:**


* Use Fresh Desk to log, track, and prioritize customer inquiries and technical issues.
* Accurately document customer interactions and solutions in the ticketing system.
* Efficiently manage ticket queues to meet service level agreements (SLAs).


**Technical Expertise:**


* Access and update customer information using Sonar CRM.
* Utilize platforms like Rancid, Tacacs+, Radius, LibreMS, GenieACS, Ruckus SmartZone Controller, and Unifi for comprehensive support.
* Stay updated on product features, system updates, and industry best practices.


**Escalation and Collaboration:**


* Escalate complex technical issues to higher support levels when necessary.
* Collaborate with network operations, engineering, and IT support teams to resolve escalated issues.
* Provide customers with status updates and ensure timely issue resolution.


**Quality Assurance:**


* Follow established procedures and service standards to deliver high-quality support.
* Participate in quality assurance activities, including call monitoring and ticket reviews, to enhance service delivery.


**Qualifications:**


* Bilingual - Spanish and English
* Associate’s degree, Bachelor’s degree, or relevant work experience.
* Previous experience in a customer service role, ideally in a call center or help desk environment.
* Basic troubleshooting skills for internet connectivity, computers, and devices.
* Proficiency in using ticketing systems like Fresh Desk and CRM systems such as Sonar.
* Ability to efficiently troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
* Familiarity with networking concepts.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a focus on customer satisfaction.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and adapt to a fast-paced setting.


**Summary of Shifts:**


* These are rotating shifts to support customers 24/7 and require flexibility.
* Work hours vary and can be subject to changes based on business requirements.


**Why You'll Love Working With This Company:**


* Join a supportive and collaborative team.
* Access ongoing learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills.


**Ready to Make a Difference?**  

If you’re passionate about helping customers and looking to grow your career, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join this team and take the next step in your professional journey!  

**This position offers an hourly rate of $15 - 18 and is a temp-to-hire opportunity based on performance.**

title: DIGITAL MERCHANDISING SPECIALIST
description:
**Location: New York, New York**  

**Job Type: Contract**  

**Compensation Range: $28.72 - 35.00 per hour**



Our client is looking for a **Digital Merchandising Specialist** to assist in developing and optimizing their apparel, footwear, accessories, goggles, and helmet categories for e-commerce. This role is crucial in enhancing their digital product content, ensuring that consumers receive the most relevant and persuasive details to maximize online conversion for our client's brands.


**Responsibilities:**



Develop & Implement Content Management Processes


* Maintain in-depth product knowledge of brand portfolio through ongoing product training and market analysis.
* Complete online item setup forms, ensuring accurate and efficient product listings.
* Lead the creation and management of new product listings.
* Optimize current catalog content and organization for better online performance.
* Collaborate with marketing and creative teams to develop compelling content for product pages, brand stores, and A+ content.
* Support the acquisition, delivery, and tracking of digital assets in partnership with Account Managers/Directors.
* Work closely with brand, marketing, and sales teams to ensure effective implementation of product content syndication tools.


Source, Organize, and Create Digital Content


* Write engaging brand and product copy for retail partners, focusing on product titles, descriptions, features, categorization, and SEO optimization.
* Ensure all product content is accurate, complete, and optimized for maximum performance.


Optimize Brand and Sales with E-Retailer Partners


* Manage product information feeds, content management, and product setup to ensure complete and optimized listings.
* Maintain and optimize parent/child variations in product listings.
* Perform quality assurance checks on merchandising efforts and the online product catalog.
* Leverage analytic tools to enhance and optimize digital shelf presence and brand performance.
* Address consumer inquiries regarding product features and benefits to improve customer satisfaction.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Communications, Merchandising, Marketing, or relevant experience.
* 2-3 years of experience in merchandising, e-commerce, or content management.
* 1-2 years of experience with the Amazon platform (Vendor/Seller Central).
* 2-3 years of copywriting and/or copy-editing experience for consumer products.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including VLOOKUPs and macros.
* Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks effectively, and meet key deadlines.
* Passionate about enhancing digital presence and educating the broader organization on digital content best practices.
* Preferred Qualifications:
	+ Experience in the optical or retail industry.
	+ Strong understanding of the retail environment and consumer behavior.
	+ Strategic, analytical, and creative thinker.
	+ Knowledge of marketplace management.

title: LSAT Prep Instructor, Rutgers University
description:
Job Description
LSAT Teacher JD
Join Kaplan’s growing community of test-prep experts as a part-time, hybrid LSAT Instructor!
Our teachers enjoy competitive pay and a flexible, hybrid schedule while helping students realize their potential. We take the pain out of planning and prepping by providing our teachers with a suite of learning-science backed resources, prepared curriculum, and score-boosting strategies. This opportunity is a great fit for current law students, those taking a gap year or deferred admission, or those just interested in lifelong education and making a difference in the lives of other students.
As a LSAT Teacher, you’ll:* Enjoy a flexible, hybrid, part-time teaching schedule, as most courses take place on weekends and/or evenings
* Support students both in and out of class enabling them to solve problems with logic and critical thinking
* Use data to close the opportunity gap for underrepresented students

title: Center-Based Behavior Technician
description:
**Step Up Family Services is currently seeking dedicated Behavior Technicians to join our rapidly growing team at our learning center in Parsippany, NJ!**

Step Up Family Services provide several services including advocacy for children, In-Home therapy and Behavioral Assistance, in-home and center-based ABA services and Classroom Support Training. We are proud to help raise the bar for each child and family we work with by working collaboratively and empowering each of them to accomplish the goals they set out to reach. Whether it is Social Emotional Learning in the classroom or Behavioral Health and Therapeutic Services, our belief is we can step up and do it together.

**We are looking for several Behavioral Technician (BT) for our Brick Learning Center program:** 

- Monday to Friday: 8-12 pm & 3:30-7:30 pm (full-time): 30-40 hours/week

- Monday to Friday: 3:30-7:30 pm (part-time): 15-20 hours/week

Behavior Technicians (BTs) are responsible for the day-to-day/session-to-session implementation of intensive in-home ABA services for youths with intellectual and or developmental disabilities based on the principles of behavior.

Under the guidance and supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA), BTs will implement ABA strategies and interventions with children between the ages of 2-8 years old in developing communication, social, and adaptive skills and reduction in mild to severe problem behaviors. Our goal is to help the children and families we serve live happier and healthier lives, and become a more productive member of their household and overall community.

*Start your career with us!* We're always looking for individuals passionate about working with children and children with autism. We can teach you ABA, it's much harder to teach you to love your job!

**Qualifications**  
- Applied behavior analysis  
- Patient care experience  
- Knowledge of HIPAA regulations  
- Strong communication skills  
- Experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities  
- Ability to assist with patient assessments  
- Familiarity with medical documentation and terminology  
- Excellent interpersonal skills  
- Data collection and analysis abilities  
- Experience in behavioral therapy and special education

title: Home Health Aide Dover NJ
description:
**Overview:**  

As a Home Health Aide near Dover NJ at Vitality Health Care, you will play a crucial role in providing compassionate care and support to individuals in the comfort of their own homes. You will be responsible for assisting clients with their daily living activities, promoting independence, and ensuring their well-being. This position requires empathy, patience, and excellent interpersonal skills to establish trust and rapport with clients and their families.  

  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

  

* Provide personal care assistance to clients, including bathing, grooming, dressing, and toileting.


* Assist clients with mobility and transfers, using appropriate techniques and equipment.


* Support clients with their nutritional needs, including meal preparation and feeding assistance if required.


* Administer medications under the direction and supervision of a registered nurse or licensed healthcare professional.


* Perform light housekeeping tasks, such as laundry, washing dishes, and tidying living areas.


* Monitor and report changes in clients' health status or behavior to the supervising nurse or healthcare provider.


* Foster a safe and supportive environment for clients, ensuring their comfort and security at all times.


* Provide companionship and emotional support to clients, engaging in meaningful interactions and activities.


* Document all care provided accurately and timely in accordance with agency policies and procedures.


* Collaborate effectively with the interdisciplinary healthcare team, including nurses, therapists, and social workers, to ensure coordinated care delivery.


* Participate in ongoing training and educational opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge in home health care practices.


* Adhere to ethical and professional standards, maintaining confidentiality and respecting clients' rights and dignity.


* Follow infection control protocols and maintain a clean and hygienic environment to prevent the spread of illness and infection.



  

**Qualifications:**  

  

* High school diploma or equivalent required.


* Completion of a state-approved Home Health Aide training program preferred.


* Certification as a Home Health Aide (HHA)


* Previous experience in home care, long-term care, or related healthcare settings preferred.


* CPR and first aid certification preferred.


* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients, families, and healthcare professionals.


* Compassionate and empathetic attitude towards the needs of clients and their families.


* Ability to follow care plans and instructions accurately and responsibly.


* Reliable transportation and valid driver's license, if required to travel to clients' homes.


* Ability to lift and move clients safely, as needed, using proper body mechanics and assistive devices.


* Flexibility to work varying shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, based on client needs and scheduling requirements.



  

**Physical Demands:**  

  

* Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds.
* Ability to stand, walk, bend, stoop, and kneel for extended periods.
* Manual dexterity and physical stamina to perform tasks such as bathing, grooming, and light housekeeping.


  

**Working Conditions:**  

  

* Work primarily takes place in clients' homes, which may vary in terms of cleanliness, accessibility, and environmental conditions.
* Potential exposure to infectious diseases and hazardous materials, requiring adherence to safety protocols and precautions.


  

**Note:** This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position and is not exhaustive. Duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be adjusted or added as needed to meet the evolving needs of our clients and organization.

title: Director of Event Technology
description:
Markey's, a multi-state leading provider of creative audio-visual services, is seeking a full-time **Director of Event Technology** to join our team at a hotel property in Teaneck, New Jersey. The Director of Event Technology is responsible for leading the event technology team and consulting with customers and hotel event management to create defining experiences for all customer live and virtual events hosted at the venue.  

This is a full-time, salaried (exempt) role. Typical daytime hours, although occasional early mornings, late nights and weekend work may be required.
Position Responsibilities
 

* Lead the Markey's event technology team with a positive and compassionate attitude, managing all day-to-day activities regarding event technology services.


* Foster a positive working relationship between Markey's and the hotel, working effectively and professionally with hotel management, event and support staff, clients and event planners.


* Work directly with clients contracting with the hotel, requiring various services including audiovisual rental, rigging services and technical labor.


* Consult with internal and external clients; generate quotes, labor estimates & room diagrams; and provide creative as well as technical audiovisual solutions for events to help secure business at its greatest potential.


* Generate and update daily and weekly forms including but not limited to billing, daily equipment "boards", schedules, and forecasts.


* Meet on-site clients to ensure order accuracy & functionality, assist in set-up and teardown of A/V equipment, coordinate and act as on-site liaison for events.


* Attend all site visits, BEO meetings, and pre-event meetings.


* Coordinate equipment and labor needs with other Markey's locations.


* Follow and maintain existing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for event management and operational functions.


* Responsible for annual budget, managing revenue and expense, and on-site inventory management to meet or exceed expectations.


* Fulfill other duties as assigned to ensure success of Markey's events.


Requirements


* Minimum one year of experience directing event technology, operations and sales.
* Ability to document sales goals, event surveys, and revenue forecasts.
* Must have functional knowledge of flown audio systems for performance.
* Must have functional knowledge of HD video switching, cameras and video playback & recording.
* Must have functional knowledge of stage lighting techniques using static and moving lights.
* Must have functional knowledge of internet bandwidth and IT configurations.
* Must have functional knowledge of rigging equipment and techniques.
* Must have excellent customer service and verbal/written communication skills, politely and promptly responding to all internal and external requests.
* Computer proficiency and thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite – Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Teams and One Drive. Ability to learn R2 program.
* Previous history of interacting positively with internal and external customers.
* Ability to maintain a professional appearance and attitude at all times.
* Must possess excellent time management and multitasking skills by balancing workload between reviewing projects, attending meetings and conference calls, face-to-face customer interactions, on-site event support, billing and overall account management.
* Must possess a high level of detail in all work including account management, organizing event information, arranging and managing pre and post-production services.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule as dictated by business needs.
Become a part of our team!


Established in 1959 and with more than 60 years of experience in the rental & staging industry, Markey's prides ourself in providing the BEST SERVICE and MOST DIVERSE & RELIABLE EQUIPMENT the industry has to offer. We are committed to providing a good working environment where all employees treat each other with respect and dignity, where employees are encouraged to grow personally and professionally, and we help employees produce quality results of which they can be proud.  

At Markey's we are a 100% Employee-Owned Company and we participate in an ESOP, or the Employee Stock Ownership Plan! The ESOP gives our Full-Time employees a beneficial ownership stake in the company at no cost to them. Ask us about our ESOP and its many benefits!  

﻿
﻿
**We offer:**
* Competitive salary
* Training and career development
* Opportunities for advancement
* Opportunities to problem solve with creative thinking
* Opportunities to work with cutting edge technology in a high profile, fast paced atmosphere
* A wide range of experienced staff to work with and learn from on a daily basis
* Excellent, comprehensive benefit program for full-time employees including group health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance, 401(k), paid time off and paid holidays, cell phone stipend, and the Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP)

Check us out at **www.markeys.com**!
About Markey's


Markey’s is a 100% employee-owned national audiovisual firm headquartered in Indianapolis with offices throughout the United States. Our experience and capabilities are diverse, comprehensive, and unparalleled. Let us help you create a defining experience at your next live event. Learn more at our website or contact us at info@markeys.com  

  

As an employee-owned company, the Markey’s team is filled with talented people who truly care about the work they do, the clients they serve, and the company they represent.

Markey's, a multi-state leading provider of creative audio-visual services, is seeking a full-time **Hotel Technician** to join our team at a hotel property in Teaneck, New Jersey. The Hotel Technician is a client-facing position responsible for setting up and operating a variety of high-end audio-visual equipment for live/virtual/hybrid client meetings hosted at the venue. Also responsible for trouble-shooting any issues, and tearing down (striking) equipment post-event.  

We are currently hiring for a Full-Time, hourly (non-exempt) position. The shift and hours will vary depending upon business need, and some evening & weekend work is required.
Position Responsibilities
 

* Work closely with clients and the in-house Operations team to ensure the successful completion of events.


* Set-up, tear-down, and occasional loading and unloading of equipment.


* Operate all types of audio, visual, and lighting equipment, for both live and virtual events.


* Provide excellent customer service to hotel employees and clients, promptly handling any equipment changes/requests.


* Ensure equipment is functional, safely and professionally presented, and that client is familiar or comfortable with the operation of any equipment they are utilizing.


* Trouble-shoot any equipment issues with satisfactory resolution.


* Fulfill other duties as assigned to ensure success of Markey's events.


Requirements


* Must have a good working knowledge of all types of audio visual equipment including operation, set-up, troubleshooting, and explanation of equipment.
* Ability to work in a collaborative team environment, as well as independently, and follow directions from the supervisor or on-site leader.
* Must have excellent customer service skills, and maintain a positive and professional appearance and attitude at all times.
* Must possess a high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, and ability to multi-task and prioritize work responsibilities.
* Ability to embrace Markey's culture and demonstrate company values, respect diversity, and follow all company policies and procedures.
* Physical demands include frequent bending, pushing/pulling gear, and lifting up to 70 lbs.
Become a part of our team!


Established in 1959 and with more than 60 years of experience in the rental & staging industry, Markey's prides ourself in providing the BEST SERVICE and MOST DIVERSE & RELIABLE EQUIPMENT the industry has to offer. We are committed to providing a good working environment where all employees treat each other with respect and dignity, where employees are encouraged to grow personally and professionally, and we help employees produce quality results of which they can be proud.  

At Markey's we are a 100% Employee-Owned Company and we participate in an ESOP, or the Employee Stock Ownership Plan! The ESOP gives our Full-Time employees a beneficial ownership stake in the company at no cost to them. Ask us about our ESOP and its many benefits!  

﻿
﻿
**We offer:**
* Competitive salary
* Training and career development
* Opportunities for advancement
* Opportunities to problem solve with creative thinking
* Opportunities to work with cutting edge technology in a high profile, fast paced atmosphere
* A wide range of experienced staff to work with and learn from on a daily basis
* Excellent, comprehensive benefit program for full-time employees including group health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance, 401(k), paid time off and paid holidays, cell phone stipend, and the Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP)

Check us out at **www.markeys.com**!
About Markey's


Markey’s is a 100% employee-owned national audiovisual firm headquartered in Indianapolis with offices throughout the United States. Our experience and capabilities are diverse, comprehensive, and unparalleled. Let us help you create a defining experience at your next live event. Learn more at our website or contact us at info@markeys.com  

  

As an employee-owned company, the Markey’s team is filled with talented people who truly care about the work they do, the clients they serve, and the company they represent.
company_description: Markey's is an innovative event technology company that gets the great opportunity to help create defining experiences.

title: AV Commissioning/Installation Technician
description:
**About Us:**

Since 2002, Mason Technologies has been a leader in technology integration, proudly certified as a Woman-owned Business Enterprise (WBE) both in NYC and nationally. With headquarters and a fully equipped warehouse in Deer Park, NY, an additional office in downtown NYC, and resources across the nation, we design, implement, and service innovative solutions in low-voltage structured cabling, audio visual systems, data centers, and unified security.

We serve a variety of industries including healthcare, government, higher education, and finance, always aiming to build lasting relationships based on trust, respect, and a shared vision for a better future. Our founder, Jennifer Mason, has cultivated a family-like environment that emphasizes deep care and commitment to our people and the clients and communities we serve, forming the foundation of everything we do.

At Mason Technologies, diversity and inclusion drive our hiring, ensuring we bring together the most talented individuals regardless of race, age, religion, gender identification, or sexual orientation. If you want to have a career of unparalleled growth, a team with a family-strong bond, and an unmatched atmosphere of motivated and caring professionals, apply to Mason today! Let’s craft a future together that's built upon trust, the authentic and innovative spirit of our family, and a commitment to making the world a better place.

**Our Comprehensive Employee Benefit Package**:

* Medical Coverages Available
* Dental Coverages Available
* Vision Coverages Available
* 401k with matching
* PTO (Vacation and Sick)
* 9 Paid Holidays

**Role Description:**

The Commissioning/Installation technician will primarily operate at diverse job sites, encompassing both new construction projects and existing client locations in active use. Their main responsibilities include commissioning and troubleshooting AV hardware for settings such as conference rooms, classrooms, and auditoriums. Additionally, they will collaborate with AV Lead Technicians to assist in installation and troubleshooting tasks. On-site and remote training for clients, as well as warranty support, are integral parts of this role. During periods without new installations, the technician will focus on training and mentoring technicians in system configuration, troubleshooting techniques, rack organization, and related skills. The position will predominantly cover assignments within the greater NYC area, with provisions for accommodation and transportation during travel as needed. Pursuing manufacturer training and certifications is strongly encouraged, based on the individual's availability.

**Qualifications:**

* Extensive experience with the following software: Crestron Toolbox, Extron Global Configurator Plus and Professional, Biamp Tesira, Q-Sys Designer, Zoom Rooms, Teams Rooms
* Knowledge conducting IP configurations and in Advanced Networking
* Ability handling audio signal flow and gain staging
* Knowledge in Video over IP systems
* Experience troubleshooting integrated AV Systems
* Proficient in installation of AV Systems
* Ability commissioning integrated AV Systems
* Strength in configuring managed switches
* Experience coordinating with client network teams
* Proven ability to work with a remote programmer via Teamviewer or similar
* Ability to read line drawings and schematics
* Plus if you have the following certifications: CTS, CTS-I, CTS-D, Crestron, Qsys, Extron, Dante, CompTIA Network+, Tesira

Pay: $35.00 - $50.00 per hour

* Paid time off

* Day shift

* Morning shift
* Weekends as needed

* SST 40 Hour (Required)

* New York, NY (Required)

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
**\\*\\*\\*NOW OFFERING A SIGNING BONUS -** **$500 FOR PART TIME, $1,000 FOR FULL TIME\\*\\*\\***

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Bergen, Morris, Warren and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

**What We Are Looking For?**

We are currently hiring **Direct Support Professionals (DSPs)** for our residential group homes in Bergen County (Hackensack, Bogota, Englewood).

**Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.**

**Role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

· Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, feeding etc; re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs.

· Provide training for individuals in independent living skills.

· Supervise and assist in medications taken by individuals.

· Transport, assist and advocate on medical appointments.

· Supervise self-help skills of individuals, if necessary, provide least intrusive assistance.

· Initiate and follow through on leisure time activities.

· Assist individuals in nutritional food preparation.

· Supervise individuals with proper selection and care of clothing.

· Assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the home.

· Complete accurate documentation in the Electronic Health Record (Therap) on every shift.

· Provide necessary First Aid and CPR to individuals in need.

**Requirements:**

· Applicants must be caring, responsible, and reliable.

· Must have a willingness to undergo required pre-employment drug screening, fingerprinting, Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) application, Central Registry background check, physical/PPD testing, and training.

· Applicant must have a minimum of a high school diploma/GED and a valid driver's license (in good standing and not in probationary status).

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

· Full Time and Part Time Signing Bonuses

· Incentives for select locations

· Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.

· Paid Training

· Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays

· Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & Sick Time

· Employee Referral Bonus Program

· 403b Retirement Plan

· Flexible schedules

· Competitive wages with incentives for previous training and experience

title: Carpet Store Associate
description:
Creative Flooring is looking to hire a Carpet store associate with a proven track record of selling to Interior Designers, Architects, and retail clientele. While this is preferred, we would be open to training the right candidate with sales skills in another industry. The ability to do measurements in client's homes would be beneficial.

This is a Full-time role and hours of operations are Monday - Friday 9.30 AM - 5.30 PM and alternate Saturdays 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM are mandatory.

Job Responsibilities Include:

1- Selling carpets and rugs to the customers, Managing the sales process from qualification to close. Use the appropriate sales process and customer service approach to sell flooring products and related services to clients.

2- To work with retail customers when they are in the store to help them identify the correct product based on the requirements.

3- Cold calling and other techniques to develop relationships with potential new customers (Retail / Designers / Architects).

4- Maintain a level of professional knowledge about flooring products to effectively sell to clients. Again, willing to train.

5- Take financial responsibility in processing customer transactions (deposits, payments)

6-Develop and build relationships with clients by establishing effective communication and enabling business opportunities and partnerships

7- Write, process, and review the client orders by using measuring and estimating techniques to accurately account for the total cost of the sale. Good mathimatical skills and attention to detail are needed.

8-Communicate with the customer to schedule measurement and installation appointments

9-Assist in maintaining store cleanliness including the organization of samples

10- Ability to operate Fork lift is preferred.

11- Perform other tasks and duties as assigned.

title: Business Systems Application Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced business analyst as the point person in our growing organization responsible for our resorts business systems. In this position, you will analyze existing systems, identify areas of improvement, recommend new systems and business processes. Responsibility in this position also include creating timelines and project management.

**Essential Functions:**

* Excellent interpersonal skills and solid communication with all levels of management and end users.
* Determine operational objectives by studying business functions and gathering information.
* Compile objectives for improving and streamlining company procedures related to business practices and systems.
* Analyze and recommend computer software solutions by understanding our business requirements. Constructing
* workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
* Improve systems by studying current business practices.
* Recommend controls by identifying deficient areas. Writing improved procedures.
* Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements. Form project team(s) and
* establishing a project budget.
* Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support and end user
* training.
* Analyze existing data. Suggest data cleanup options
* Identify underutilized, misconfigured or limitations of existing systems. Understand interface technologies joining individual systems.

**Requirements:**

Crystal Springs Resort utilizes the following software solutions. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with one or more of the following:

* Agilysys InfoGenesis food and beverage and retail point of sale system.
* Maestro Property Management Systems, Maestro Activities, Maestro SPA & Retail, Maestro Sales & Catering.
* Craftable inventory and procurement system.
* Aspen Visual ClubMate Sports Club System.
* EZ-Links golf tee time system.
* SevenRooms Dining and Event Reservations system.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or another graduate certificate.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to analyze and understand business operations and requirements and align software solutions.
* Ability to effectively provide project management from inception to go-live
* Prior experience with the business system listed above

**Enjoy Crystal Springs Employee Perks!**

* Discounted Minerals Sports Club Membership
* 30% Dining/Retail Discount
* 30% Spa Discount
* Discounted Stays at the Hotels
* Discounted admission to Events & Festivals
* Complimentary Golf

title: Lifeguard
description:
We're seeking experienced Lifeguards to be responsible for watching swimmers and swimmers-in-training near the water to ensure their safety. **We need candidates that can work during the following days and times during the end of this season. (it is OK if you can cover some of the days)**

Wed 28-Aug 11:00AM - 6:00PM

Thu 29-Aug 8:00AM -6:00PM

Fri 30-Aug 8:00AM -6:00PM

Sat 31-Aug 10:00AM - 7:00PM

Sun 1-Sep 10:00AM - 7:00PM

Mon 2-Sep 10:00AM - 7:00PM

Sat 7-Sep 10:00AM - 5:00PM

Sun 8-Sep 10:00AM - 6:00PM

A successful candidate must be comfortable around the water, able to take direction well and ready to help if needed. Job location is a prestigious County Club. A fun and safe work environment.

Responsibilities:

* Maintain watch over the pool area ensuring a secure and safe environment.
* Employ accident prevention by enforcing pool rules and regulations.
* Respond to all injuries, incidents, and emergencies as directed by club policy.
* Assist in the maintenance and cleanliness of the aquatics center.

The Ideal Candidate would have:

* Must be a minimum of 18 years of age
* Current accredited Lifeguarding Certification or the ability to obtain the certification at the time of hire.

title: Advocate Counselor BCHS
description:
**BRONX COMMUNITY H.S. ADVOCATE COUNSELOR** 

Mission Society of New York City improves the lives of children, youth, and families in the city’s most underserved communities. Through programs and services that respond to community needs, we create cycles of success for generations to come.

The *Level Up Program* administered at *Bronx Community High School* is a collaboration with the NYC Department of Education and New York City Mission Society. The program assists students, who are over-aged and under-credentialed, in acquiring the skills, knowledge, attitudes and behavioral changes that will maximize their potential. The program’s aim is to enable students to graduate high school, transition into post-secondary education, or into meaningful permanent employment.

**Position Summary**

**Title:** Advocate Counselor

**Program:** Bronx Community High School

**Reports To**: Program Director

**Supervises:** 

**Employment Status**: Full-Time Non-Exempt

**Basic Function:**

Provide comprehensive support services to program participants as required by the Level Up program contract and appropriate to students’ needs. Outreach to students who fail to attend school. Provide individual and group counseling to assist students with their social-emotional and academic growth. Assist senior staff in implementing post-secondary counseling and internship programs.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

· Establish a rapport with program participants.

· Provide attendance support and individual counseling on a monthly basis to caseload of program participants.

· Provide individual- and group-counseling focusing on post-secondary planning, social-emotional development, and career-readiness skills.

· Collaborate with other Level Up and Department of Education staff to track student progress and attendance, develop individualized participant support plans, and conduct telephone, in-school, and home visit outreach.

· Input data in multiple databases in a timely manner.

· Identify participants educational and career goals and help them to develop post-secondary plan.

· Assist Internship Placement Specialist in matching participants to appropriate internship opportunities.

· Assist Level Up Social Worker in providing crisis intervention services.

· Accompany participants on day- and overnight- trips to locations within and outside of New York State.

· Staff is expected to be committed to the mission, vision, and values of Mission Society and Bronx Community High School.

· Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

· Minimum of B.A. or B.S. degree

· Bilingual Spanish or French preferred

· Demonstrated interest in working with low-income students and/or students of color

· Knowledge of basic youth development principles

· Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment

· Detail oriented and capable of managing multiple simultaneous projects

**General Requirements**

Staff is expected to be committed to the mission, vision, and values of Mission Society.

**Salary and Benefits**

Salary range: $49,500-$52,500 based on experience, qualifications and fit. Comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, life, long term disability insurance, 403(b) retirement plan with 5% employer contribution, TransitChek, Employee Wellness Program, Municipal Credit Union membership, voluntary supplemental insurance options.

**Apply**

Interested and qualified individuals should forward their resumes with cover letter to: HR@missionsociety.org, RE: Bronx Community High School Advocate Counselor Position.

Visit our website at www.nycmissionsociety.org.

Note: We are unable to accept phone calls. Applicants must meet the qualifications stated above. Only applicants selected for further consideration will be contacted.

*Mission Society of New York City is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $49,500.00 - $52,500.00 per year

* Health insurance

description:

Job Summary:  
Join our team as a Business Development Manager where you will play a vital role in driving growth and revenue by identifying new business opportunities and building strong relationships with clients. - Excellent communication and negotiation skills to interact effectively with clients and internal teams.

- Familiarity with software solutions for enhancing business processes.  
- Knowledge of negotiating techniques and strategies for successful deal closures.

We offer competitive compensation packages, professional development opportunities, and a collaborative work environment where your contributions are valued. title: Linux Kernel Developer
description:
Your Role and Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities will comprise of design and specifications for new enhancements, coding, test automation, problem determination and bug fixing, performance analysis, and solving client problems. Your attendance at Open Source community meetings is recommended and supported, and client facing activities (e.g. client support, providing lectures at conferences) are possible. You will closely interact with the respective Open Source communities (“upstream integration” of your code) and our distribution partners (Red Hat, SUSE, Canonical).

Required Technical and Professional Expertise:

3+ years of experience in Open Source development in one or more areas of Linux Kernel, KVM, QEMU, virtio

2+ years of experience in low-level/assembler development on Arm architectures (preferably 64bit)

Expert skills in operating systems internals (e.g. memory management & task scheduling, interrupts, device drivers)

Expert skills in source code repository systems (e.g. git), scripting languages (e.g. Python) and test Automation (e.g. Jenkins) skills

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Contributions to Open Source projects or Open Source maintainer status (for multiple years)

Skills in current I/O technologies (e.g. PCI, NVMe, RDMA)

Skills in virtualization and emulation technologies (e.g. QEMU TCG)

Skills in platform and I/O device management (e.g. UEFI, ACPI)

You are highly motivated

Demonstrated communication skills

title: Floating Residential Coordinator
description:
**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Morris, Bergen, and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

We are currently seeking a **Full Time Floating Residential Coordinator** for our programs in **Bergen County, Morris County, Somerset County** **and Warren County**. The Residential Coordinator will oversee **all** group homes serving individuals with developmental, intellectual and physical disabilities.

Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree required.
* Required to pass all background screening including, drug screening, fingerprinting, reference check, and physical/PPD, CARI checks.
* This position reports to the Assistant Residential Director and Residential Director.

**Role of a Coordinator:**

* Through supervision of the group home managers, assure quality of training and supervision of group home consumers.
* Through supervision of the group home managers, responsible for the physical welfare of the consumers.
* Responsible for assisting the Managers with financial running of the house.
* Responsible for the coordination of the maintenance of the facility.
* The Residential Coordinator is to be in regular communication with the Residential Director about consumer behavior and programming within the home and consistently reviewing all records.
* Responsible for house compliance with DDD manual of Standards and for always maintaining the program in a manner appropriate for inspection.
* Assist in the development and implementation of the ISP.
* Ensure that all ISP goals and data are consistently completed.
* Responsible for reviewing monthly notes and assuring they are completed accurately.
* Responsible for participating in the implementation of behavior management plans as needed, utilizing techniques and supervising staff in the appropriate implementation of such.
* Responsible for ensuring that the house programs and physical environment provides a safe, enriched, and respectful atmosphere for the consumers.
* Be on call and responsible for handling all emergencies, as determined by Residential Director.
* Responsible for attending future trainings and meetings on an as needed basis and in a timely manner.
* Responsible for all other duties as assigned by the Residential Director.
* Agrees to fully cooperate with Avidd Management and DHS/DDD in any inspection or investigation.

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

* Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.
* Paid Training
* Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays
* Generous Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Sick pay
* 403b Retirement Plan
* Student Loan Forgiveness Plan

**APPLY TODAY ON INDEED!**

title: Dispatcher/Router
description:
**About Us:**

Since 2002, Mason Technologies has been a leader in technology integration, proudly certified as a Woman-owned Business Enterprise (WBE) both in NYC and nationally. With headquarters and a fully equipped warehouse in Deer Park, NY, an additional office in downtown NYC, and resources across the nation, we design, implement, and service innovative solutions in low-voltage structured cabling, audio visual systems, data centers, and unified security.

We serve a variety of industries including healthcare, government, higher education, and finance, always aiming to build lasting relationships based on trust, respect, and a shared vision for a better future. Our founder, Jennifer Mason, has cultivated a family-like environment that emphasizes deep care and commitment to our people and the clients and communities we serve, forming the foundation of everything we do.

At Mason Technologies, diversity and inclusion drive our hiring, ensuring we bring together the most talented individuals regardless of race, age, religion, gender identification, or sexual orientation. If you want to have a career of unparalleled growth, a team with a family-strong bond, and an unmatched atmosphere of motivated and caring professionals, apply to Mason today! Let’s craft a future together that's built upon trust, the authentic and innovative spirit of our family, and a commitment to making the world a better place.

**Our Comprehensive Employee Benefit Package**:

* Medical Coverages Available
* Dental Coverages Available
* Vision Coverages Available
* 401k with matching
* PTO (Vacation and Sick)
* 9 Paid Holidays

**Position:**

Summary:

The Mason Family is looking for a qualified Dispatcher/Router to join our team. Your role here involves being responsible for the daily dispatch of all technicians and on-site personnel while coordinating the internal operations of your assigned projects. There is no greater opportunity than here with us at Mason. We want to take care of you financially and surround you with the best environment for you to succeed!

Responsibilities:

* Act with flexibility and maneuver complex situations that may arise while routing.
* Maintain knowledge of assigned projects and take pride in providing the appropriate directions for field personnel
* Play a key role in our quality and service standards by validating that the proper information in provided in the routing assignments
* Communicate with Office and Field teams to confirm daily requirements

* Maintain internal software and manage the system in place to assign tickets to technicians and route resources accordingly
* Perform other related duties as required and assigned
* Keep a database and learn overtime technician skillsets to become more proficient at appropriate routing

Required Skills:

* Superior organizational skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* High level knowledge of Microsoft Office specifically Excel
* Elite ability to operate computer software such as CRM and ERP systems
* Ability to multitask
* Capable of thriving in a fast-paced environment
* Professionalism is a must as well as the ability to handle situations under pressure
* A strong desire to win, learn, and grow
* Commitment to the hours necessary to complete assignments

If you are looking for a place to plant roots and build your career, this is the best team to join. We are a serious organization, but we are a family and look forward to growing together.

title: Family Case Worker
description:
**Family Case Manager**

Grand Central Neighborhood Social Services Corporation (GCNSSC) is currently seeking a Family Case Manager. In this role, you will serve as a crucial support figure, providing assistance and care to residents within our facility. Your main objective is to cultivate a secure, nurturing, and welcoming atmosphere for residents, fostering their independence and overall welfare.

· Ongoing case management with a focus on screening and making appropriate referrals to address the Family’s needs in the following domains: safety issues, education, health, mental health, legal/immigration proceedings, substance abuse, independent living, criminal/juvenile justice, child enrichment activities.

* Utilizing assessment tools, such as CARES, tailored to identify support service requirements unique to the asylum-seeking population, and making immediate referrals.
* Developing Individualized Living Plans (ILPs) in close collaboration with other Social Service providers, ensuring tailored support services that align with the family’s journey.
* Completing CARES assessments including psycho-social, within the first 30 days of intake, with sensitivity to the family’s experience.
* Monitoring and tracking client progress, addressing the specific challenges faced by the family.
* Empowering clients to actively participate in their own immigration approval and shelter discharge planning and goal setting.
* Conducting regular meetings with clients (weekly/bi-weekly or as needed) to address their unique circumstances and emotional needs.
* Collaborating with legal and advocacy organizations to ensure clients receive necessary support during their asylum proceedings.
* Connecting clients with culturally sensitive resources to aid in their adjustment and integration into the community.
* Maintaining thorough client files, documenting conversations, warnings, and progress reports while preserving the utmost confidentiality.
* Assist with establishing strong partnerships with Legal, medical, social, employment and community organizations to facilitate referrals and support services.
* Ensuring that case notes are completed within 48 hours after client meetings.
* Offering support as a substitute for other staff when needed.
* Performing general clerical duties.

· Provide crisis intervention services directly, as needed, or connect family to services to ensure minor's safety and well-being in a crisis situation.

· Meets regularly with the immediate supervisor as a means of enhancing professional growth, reviewing and processing the provision of case management services, and dealing with appropriate administrative issues.

· Other duties as needed.

Requirements: Proficient in MS Office Applications (Word, Outlook, Excel) with a minimal of (2) Two years experience working in the field of Social Services with the homeless population especially with families.

Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in pertaining field. Bi-lingual in Spanish and English preferred. Strong organization and planning skills, work management and prioritizing skills, strong verbal and written communication skills, problem solving ability, attention to detail and teamwork. Hours are 11:00am -7:00pm, (2) two weekends per month.

Benefits: We offer medical, vision; and dental, 401k, and life insurance. Starts with two (2) weeks paid vacation, which increase to five weeks after five years. Depending on the schedule – Paid Holidays, five sick days; and three personal days.

Must sign attestation stating that candidate has not been the subject of a founded child abuse report. Must obtain Annual PPD Test. May be required to become First Aid/CPR certified. May be required to become certified in overdose prevention.

description:
Are you a graduate student in mental health looking to learn about private practice while earning extra income? Join our team as an **Administrative Assistant** and gain hands-on experience in a thriving private practice.

**Job Overview:**  
We are seeking a driven, enthusiastic, motivated, ambitious, and compassionate **Administrative Assistant** who is passionate about mental health and wellness. In this role, you will be responsible for connecting potential clients with our services, guiding them through the intake process, and ensuring they find the support they need. Alongside client engagement and sales responsibilities, you will also manage essential administrative tasks that support our practice's day-to-day operations.

**What You’ll Gain:**

* **Real-World Experience:** Work in a private practice setting, learning the ropes of client relations, sales, administrative support, and practice management.
* **Professional Development:** Receive training from experienced clinicians to deepen your knowledge of evidence-based practices.
* **Flexible Hours:** Enjoy part-time, flexible hours that fit around your class schedule, allowing you to balance work, study, and personal life.
* **Income While You Learn:** Earn competitive pay while gaining valuable experience that will boost your future career.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Assist with client intake, scheduling, billing, and general administrative tasks including collecting and processing necessary paperwork and documentation.
* Proactively reach out to individuals, families, and referral sources to introduce them to our services.
* Educate prospective clients about our range of services and how we can support their mental health journey.
* Use sales techniques to effectively communicate the value of our services and convert inquiries into consultations.
* Support practice management and learn about the business side of mental health services.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with potential clients, understanding their needs and concerns.
* Coordinate and facilitate initial consultations, ensuring a smooth and welcoming process for new clients.
* Collaborate with the clinical team to match clients with the appropriate services and therapists.
* Follow up with clients to ensure they are satisfied with their experience and continue to receive the support they need.
* Participate in community outreach activities to raise awareness of our practice and services.
* Handle administrative tasks such as managing client records, scheduling appointments, processing payments, and responding to inquiries via phone and email.
* Maintain accurate records of client interactions, outreach efforts, and sales performance.
* Ensure the front office is well-organized and provides a welcoming environment for clients.

**Qualifications:**

* Currently enrolled in a graduate program in mental health (e.g., psychology, counseling, social work).
* Strong interest in private practice and promoting and educating others on evidence-based treatments in addition to comfort in answering new inquiry questions and providing good customer service.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with people from diverse backgrounds.
* Demonstrates the ability to handle feedback constructively and views it as an opportunity for growth and improvement
* A passion for mental health and a commitment to helping others.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Priority given to those with previous experience in a sales, client-facing, or administrative role, preferably in healthcare or mental health.

**About Us:**  
At Center for Anxiety and Behavior Management, we are dedicated to helping individuals and families overcome life's challenges and achieve a sense of well-being. We specialize in providing evidence-based, high-quality mental health services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients.

**If you're passionate about mental health, have a talent for sales, and are eager to help others find the support they need, we would love to hear from you!**

title: Low-Voltage Technician (Structured Cabling, AV, Security)
description:
**About Us:**

Since 2002, Mason Technologies has been a leader in technology integration, proudly certified as a Woman-owned Business Enterprise (WBE) both in NYC and nationally. With headquarters and a fully equipped warehouse in Deer Park, NY, an additional office in downtown NYC, and resources across the nation, we design, implement, and service innovative solutions in low-voltage structured cabling, audio visual systems, data centers, and unified security.

We serve a variety of industries including healthcare, government, higher education, and finance, always aiming to build lasting relationships based on trust, respect, and a shared vision for a better future. Our founder, Jennifer Mason, has cultivated a family-like environment that emphasizes deep care and commitment to our people and the clients and communities we serve, forming the foundation of everything we do.

At Mason Technologies, diversity and inclusion drive our hiring, ensuring we bring together the most talented individuals regardless of race, age, religion, gender identification, or sexual orientation. If you want to have a career of unparalleled growth, a team with a family-strong bond, and an unmatched atmosphere of motivated and caring professionals, apply to Mason today! Let’s craft a future together that's built upon trust, the authentic and innovative spirit of our family, and a commitment to making the world a better place.

**Our Comprehensive Employee Benefit Package**:

* CWA 1104 Union Affiliation
* Paid for Medical Coverage (Not Including Dependents)
* Dental Coverages Available
* Vision Coverages Available
* 401k with matching
* PTO (Vacation and Sick)
* Prevailing Wage Available for our Proven Top Technicians!
* Full W-2 Employment
* 9 Paid Holidays with an additional 3 Floating Holidays

**Position:**

You will be in the field completing the physical installation of Structured Cabling Systems such as but not limited to: AV Systems, Paging/Telephone Systems, and Security Systems. You will be working closely with fellow technicians, lead technicians, and project managers. We are looking for experienced candidates that have been in the field with extensive knowledge on installation and troubleshooting of these systems to help us to produce Mason quality work.

**Responsibilities:**

* Pulling Low Voltage Cable
* Patch Panel Terminations
* Rack and Stack Installations
* Door Access Control Installation
* Head End Wiring
* Install and Service Security Systems
* Installation and Programming of AV devices
* Fiber terminations and splicing
* Experience with Ribbon Fiber is a plus
* Understanding IDF, MDF, and Data Center builds
* Reviewing floor plans, line diagrams and rack elevations to ensure successful installation
* Submitting Daily Reports to the office to outline project status and work performed
* Interface with customers on each job site representing Mason Technologies with respect and integrity
* Leave each job site clean and organized at the end of each day and spot checked at the completion of each project

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum 5 years of experience with Low Voltage, AV, Security, and/or Paging systems
* Ability to commute and arrive on time to job sites in the NYC region, Long Island, and New Jersey
* Clean driving record
* Ability to lift over 50 lbs
* Capable of bending, lifting, crouching, and leaning over for long periods of time
* Possession of OSHA 30 and SST 10 physical cards

If you are looking for a place to plant roots and build your career, this is the best team to join. We are a serious organization, but we are a family and look forward to growing together.

title: Nurse Practitioner - Clinical Outpatient Palliative Medicine
description:
**Title: Nurse Practitioner - Clinical Outpatient Palliative Medicine** 

**Location: Upper East Side** 

**Org Unit: Clinical Geriatrics** 

**Work Days: Monday-Friday** 

**Exemption Status: Exempt**

**Salary Range: $145,800.00 - $156,600.00** 

\\*As required under NYC Human Rights Law Int 1208-2018 - Salary range for this role when Hired for NYC Offices

**Position Summary**

In collaboration with an attending physician, is responsible for the coordination and direct care of patients within specialty area(s) and clinical protocols as needed. This role is also responsible for providing patient education.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Responsible for patient care on an inpatient and/or outpatient service.
* Where applicable, establishes priorities for nursing care through patient assessment and develops nursing care plans. Prepares equipment and assists provider during examination, testing, and treatment of patients as needed.
* Coordinates multidisciplinary health care services and arranges diagnostic tests as ordered by physician(s) when needed. Performs inpatient diagnostic testing, therapeutic, and interventional procedures in conjunction with physician as needed.
* Triages patient inquiries and communicates test results.
* As needed, administers appropriate injections and medications as ordered by medical providers in compliance with state law and clinic guidelines. Educates patients and staff on pharmacological/drug effects and protocol requirements, if applicable.
* When needed, records medical information within the patients’ electronic medical record as appropriate.
* May be required to reach out to referring physicians and promote new referrals.
* May be responsible for the precertification and preauthorization of prescriptions.
* Participates in safety programs and orientation of new staff. Assists in reviewing and revising policies and procedures.
* Ensures infection control compliance within the practice and quality assurance in all aspects of patient care as mandated by institutional, local, state and federal regulatory agency requirements.
* When needed, maintains inventory of supplies, equipment and/or reagents. May order supplies/equipment/reagents as authorized. Receives supply orders and confirms accuracy of delivery. May assist with cost control.
* Attends workshops, seminars and/or conferences to keep abreast of standards and best practices within the field. Disseminates information to colleagues and/or staff as appropriate.
* If applicable, assesses patient eligibility and reviews patient medical history for inclusion in clinical studies.
* Manages the care of selected patients using protocols agreed upon by medical/nursing personnel. Prescribes and adjusts medications. Makes judgments about the use of pharmaceutical agents as standard treatments in diagnosed conditions.
* If applicable, reviews and completes protocol history sheets, flow sheets, study follow-up reports and patient evaluation forms. Prepares and amends IRB protocols, consent forms and research documents.
* If applicable, for surgical procedures, responsible for gathering, completing and delivering all pre-operative requirements required for surgery. Reviews discharge summaries and operative notes for accuracy.

**Education**

* Master’s of Science Degree in Nursing

**Experience**

Approximately 2 or more years of clinical experience as an NP in a physician practice or hospital setting, preferably within a related specialty.

New graduates with related RN experience may be considered.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

* Demonstrated critical thinking and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).
* A team oriented individual that works collaboratively to achieve team goals.

**Licenses and Certifications**

* NYS Registered Nurse Practitioner (NP) license and current NP registration
* NYS Registered Professional Nurse license and current RN registration
* Applicable National Board Certification (such as ANCC, PNCB, etc)
* Current BLS (must be issued by American Heart Association)
* Infection Control Certificate
* Current Narcotics DEA registration certificate

Working Conditions/Physical Demands

Weill Cornell Medicine is a comprehensive academic medical center that is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery, and the education of future physicians and scientists in New York City and around the world. Our doctors and scientists - faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and the Weill Cornell Physician Organization - are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Our medical practices serve communities throughout New York City, and our faculty provide comprehensive care at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Brooklyn Methodist Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Westchester Behavioral Health Center, and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. At Weill Cornell Medicine, we work together to treat each individual, not just their conditions or illnesses, as we strive to deliver the finest possible care for our patients - the center of everything we do. Weill Cornell Medicine is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Weill Cornell Medicine provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to protected status, including race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

title: Veterinarian
description:
**This role requires working fulltime on-site at the Skirball Center for Innovation based in Orangeburg, New York.**

**SUMMARY**

The Veterinarian provides daily veterinary care at SCI, provides preventive and ongoing clinical veterinary care for all SCI laboratory animals; oversees the anesthesia and surgical programs of the Center; and maintains all practices in accordance with AAALAC, USDA, OLAW and NY State Department of Health standards.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Provides veterinary care to all SCI laboratory animal species under supervision of the Director, Operations.

· Assists in maintaining a comprehensive surgical and clinical veterinary care program that assures appropriate animal welfare, and provides high quality animal health care and support for a rapidly expanding pre-clinical research program focused on cardiovascular device development and testing, and the investigation of novel therapies for the treatment of cardiovascular disease.

· Prepares and maintains a variety of records concerning physical examinations and diagnostic decisions ensuring compliance with study protocols and applicable regulations.

· Participates in training and educational activities involving the use of animals for the SCI veterinary staff and research team.

· Maintains interest in pursuing postgraduate training in laboratory animal medicine, and the training of veterinary students and post-doctoral associates.

· Engages in multidisciplinary research activities including developing animal models, testing, analysis and publications with particular focus on veterinary cardiovascular medicine.

· Maintains high professional standards.

· Acts to promote the interests of the Foundation.

· Provides guidance to technical veterinary staff and makes clinical decisions under the direction of the Director, Operations.

· Assures compliance with the study protocol and any protocol amendments.

· Records observations onto appropriate record forms.

· Ensures adequate sanitary and health care precautions for all SCI research animals.

· Documents any circumstance that may affect animal welfare, and/or the quality and integrity of a study.

· Reports any health or medical condition that may adversely affect a study to the Director, Operations, Manager of Animal Care and Principal Investigator.

· Additional duties as assigned

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES IN GLP STUDIES**

· Participates in study protocol development, approval and amendments as required.

· Assures GLP compliance in the area of animal health by providing personnel oversight and documentation review.

· Examines animals upon receipt and during the study for routine health evaluations and medical emergencies

· Performs or oversees the performance of animal health care assessment prior to release for study enrollment in both non-GLP and GLP studies, and during the in-life phase of all pre-clinical studies.

· Oversees all aspects of health assessment and health management of study animals, including diagnostic and therapeutic decisions, in communication with veterinary staff and study directors.

· Participates in all aspects of veterinary care at SCI and satellite facilities.

· Performs, or oversees performance of veterinary diagnostic and therapeutic procedures in study animals as required.

· Performs or assists in necropsies as required.

· Compiles, organizes and prepares, or oversees the compilation, organization and preparation of animal health-related data for final report preparation.

· Documents any circumstances that may affect animal welfare, and the quality and integrity of a study and assesses the impact on study outcome.

· Assures corrective actions in the animal care and veterinary arena are made in a timely manner and documented in an appropriate manner.

· Reviews clinical pathology results and health records of laboratory animals involved in both non-GLP and GLP studies. Communicates findings to veterinary staff and study directors as appropriate.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

· DVM/VMD degree from an AVMA accredited institution or equivalent.

· Veterinary licensure in at least one state required (NY State preferred).

· USDA Veterinary Accreditation required.

· 3-5 years of work experience in companion animal or mixed animal (sheep or swine preferred) clinical practice highly desired.

· Experience in an animal research environment is desired but not mandatory

· Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook. Knowledge of Microsoft products and any animal facility-related software.

· Strong focus on flexibility, ability to multi-task, attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, good follow-up and judgment. Must be able to prioritize.

· Must possess excellent communication and writing skills, patience, professionalism and ability to effectively interact with staff and management alike.

· Ability to analyze complex information and solve problems relating to the proper care of laboratory animals.

**BENEFITS**

· Choice of health plans include medical, Dental, and vision coverage

· Company-paid short-term and long-term disability and life insurance

· Health and dependent care flexible spending accounts

· Pre-tax travel expenses through TransitChek program

· 401(k) plan

· Generous paid time off (PTO)

· Ten paid holidays each year

**COMPENSATION**

The hiring range for this position is $125,000 - $155,000. The annual salary that will ultimately be offered to the successful candidate will depend on job-related knowledge, education, skills, and experience.

**CONTACT INFORMATION**

To be considered for this opportunity, please submit your resume.

Be sure and visit our web site to learn more about how we strive to enhance and save patient lives every day www.crf.org

***CRF is an equal opportunity employer.***
