title: Segment Producer, Morning News NOW
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

NBC News NOW is seeking a talented segment producer who thrives in a breaking news, fast-paced and deadline-driven environment for Morning News NOW– the kickoff to News NOW’s day.  

  

We’re looking for a segment producer with experience working in LIVE news programming who can produce stories that are visually compelling/impactful and can work well with a team to make it happen. The ideal candidate is comfortable with turning segments quickly and accurately in a fast-changing, breaking news environment. Additionally, this segment producer should have a passion for compelling topics, making \\*any\\* story more interesting and enjoy telling those stories in a conversational way.  

  

This position is represented by the News Guild-CWA NY.

 **Responsibilities/Job Duties**

* Research, write and produce strong editorial copy with speed and accuracy in a fast-paced environment
* Produce live segments for live morning show, including writing sharp questions and identifying the strongest possible elements
* Pitch the most relevant, timely and compelling ideas for day-of and future segments
* Multi-task and juggle producing multiple stories for regular and breaking-news programming
* Mine and edit the best video and sound for assigned stories
* Quality check all video content
* Keep senior producers and the EP up to date with daily news development of assigned stories

 **Qualifications** **Basic Qualifications**

* You’ve been working in broadcast, digital or cable news for 5+ years – preferably working on live daily shows or in and around a control room
* Excellent writing skills
* You’ve got thorough knowledge of current events
* Excellent editorial judgment
* You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where news is breaking, rundowns are changing and deadlines are tight
* You thrive in a team environment where collaboration is key
* Willingness and ability to work overnight/early morning hours – the shift is Monday – Friday, 2a – 10a ET.
* You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of relevant working experience
* You are willing to work in New York, New York
* Must be willing and able to work flexible hours, under tight deadline pressure, including breaking news.

 **Desired Qualifications**

* You’ve got big ideas and the journalistic writing and research skills to bring them to life
* You’re familiar with iNEWS, can search and edit footage and cut your own VOs and SOTs
* When the news cycle calls you answer, even after you’ve already put in a long day
* You live for the moments when news is breaking and time to air is short

 **Additional Requirements:**

* **Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.


This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website. Salary range: $85,000 - $110,000

 **Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity  

or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual  

orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed  

services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the  

right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your  

ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can

title: Store Manager - Intimissimi at one of our Manhattan, NYC locations ($63k-$66k)
description:
Intimissimi is searching for a passionate Store Manager for one of our Manhattan, NYC locations!

**THE ROLE**

The Store Manager is a people and business-oriented profile, which is the key reference point for the store team and will be responsible for overseeing the efficient operations of the store. Our Store Managers always lead their teams by sharing their passion for client service and expertise in fashion. With a people-oriented mindset, Store Managers strive to effectively train and develop their teams to become future leaders.

**LIFE OF THE STORE MANAGER**

The Store Manager sets the tone for the store team and is crucial in creating a memorable in-store experience that builds lasting relationships with customers and solves their lifestyle needs. This role is critical in supporting the execution of the store strategy to achieve performance goals and drive profitable sales growth through all aspects, including customer and product operations, merchandising, and talent development. The Store Manager approaches challenges with an innovative mindset and sees the big picture executing the mission with a positive attitude and great professionalism.

Be a mentor for your team! **You always demonstrate Oniverse’s Key Values: Open Minded, Authentic, Passionate, Dynamic, Team Player, Pragmatic!**

**OPEN MINDED**: Open to learning and receiving guidance and feedback from store leadership. You embrace new ideas, are receptive to customer feedback, and approach challenges with a willingness to explore innovative solutions. You understand the diverse needs and preferences of guests and colleagues, fostering an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere within the store. You actively engage with guests, adapt to ever-changing trends, ensuring a personalized shopping experience.

**AUTHENTIC**: Be real! Honesty is key and always working together with integrity. Store Managers embody genuineness and sincerity. You enjoy authentically connecting with guests, sharing your passion for the brand while fostering loyal and long-lasting relationships with guests and colleagues. **#WeAreOne** We support and encourage a respectful and inclusive team atmosphere by welcoming Diversity, Inclusion and Equity for all team members and guests.

**PASSIONATE**: Share your excitement and promote brand loyalty with guests and store team. As a Store Manager you have firsthand experience with new fashion collections and can share newness with all guests. Share your passion for Intimissimi by building brand loyalty with each guest! Your goal is ensuring each guest has a memorable experience in our shops.

**DYNAMC**: Store Managers thrive in a fast-paced environment, embracing change and adaptability. You will be able to navigate busy hours, responding with care to guests’ inquiries and requests, supporting with visuals updates, assisting with stock management practices, and overall contributing to a seamless shopping experience for guests and efficient environment for colleagues.

**TEAM PLAYER**: We are all in this together! Our Store Managers believe in teamwork through all day-to-day activities to ensure high quality experience for guests, but also supporting each other every step of the way. You collaborate effectively with colleagues, fostering a positive and cooperative atmosphere in the shop. Being part of Intimissimi means lending a helping hand to colleagues, being a mentor for new colleagues, creating a unified and motivated network that delivers high quality guest experience.

**PRAGMATIC**: You are a problem solver! You approach challenges with practicality and resourcefulness, finding effective solutions together with your colleagues and store leadership that align with the store’s goals and guests’ needs. Always balancing creativity and efficiency, while following company policies and procedures.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures.
* Demonstrate sales leadership by playing an active role on the sales floor through customer engagement with top clients, ensuring the highest level of customer service is provided.
* Enforcing exceptional customer service, maximizing and expanding customers’ portfolio utilizing your ability to multi-task projects in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment
* Ensure Clients follow-up by the Sales Team, with customized proposals specifically tailored for their needs
* Achieve and exceed personal sales and productivity goals agreed upon with the District

Manager

* Always representing the brand’s standards for a high-level customer experience
* Be a mentor for your team, inspiring and leading them through product knowledge and brand awareness
* Manage a team of 8-10 individuals
* Proactively follow current competitors and fashion trends
* Attract, recruit and retain a high performing team in an inspiring work environment
* Promote brand awareness, establish store presence and capture competitive market share through community outreach and company sponsored events

**Operations**

* Oversee the processing of daily incoming and outbound merchandise requests and shipments to coordinate the stockroom
* Implement business action plans in collaboration with the District Manager to enhance sales for each product category and client tier segment
* Manage and support stock levels through direct communication with the District Manager to maintaining a high sell through as well as alignment with new product launched
* Able to successfully operate our POS system, conduct email, opening and closing procedures
* Store Cleanliness: at our stores, we take great pride in providing our customers with a clean and well-maintained shopping environment. This includes the cleanliness and organization of the store: including but not limited to the salesfloor, fitting rooms, cash desk area, and backroom areas such as bathroom and stockroom. As a retail employee, you are expected to take the initiative of upkeeping the cleanliness in the store.

Teams will be required to conduct daily cleaning tasks included but not limited to:

* Dust and clean shelves, furniture, fixtures and decor
* Clean doors, window glass, mirrors (exterior and interior)
* Pick up and empty trash cans and garbage taking it to the dumpster as needed
* Sweep and mop hard floors
* Wipe and sanitize sinks, countertops, shared common areas and equipment

**Performance Management**

* Train and communicate current collection knowledge to all team members to ensure they are fully educated on brand guidelines and season strategy
* Utilize fashion expertise to inspire others and build collaborative partnerships in a team-focused environment
* Supporting the Team in maintaining the visual and housekeeping standards of the store
* Conduct coaching and counseling sessions with the team to review performance and provide constructive, timely feedback
* Oversee performance check in process for all store employees and establish individual goals
* Identify and create action plans for team members in collaboration with the District Manager
* Provide accurate monthly schedules by analyzing peak hours to ensure adequate floor coverage and timely submissions of payroll records for all employees
* The Store Manager may be assigned other responsibilities as the direct manager deems fit, pending the company’s business needs and career development purposes.
* Communicate Company set KPi’s and identify strategies to ensure performance standards are met
* Assisting with Store Events: Participating in the planning and the execution of promotional events, product launches, and other initiatives to drive foot traffic and boost sales.

**TEAM DYNAMIC**

* Liaison between Key holders and Assistant Managers to ensure clients experience high quality customer service, completing store operations efficiently and implementing sales strategies thus meeting and exceeding commercial goals.
* Provides training to Key holders and Assistant Managers which may include cross-department functions.
* Based on your experience with Intimissimi and performance, you may be selected to support NEW Stores Openings across the US as a team bonding opportunity and a chance to put your skills and knowledge to the test!
* Participate in nationwide contests within other Intimissimi locations to show our team spirit!

**CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES**

All Store Managers get the chance to learn new skills daily. We believe in hands-on experience training in different store functions to develop an entrepreneur mindset and spirit, such as: Guest Experience, Basic Store Operations, Business Acumen, Visuals Merchandising, Stock Management, and much more!

**#TeamworkMakesTheDreamWork**

We are all team players! Our leaders always encourage development between team members to support professional growth.

**#KnowledgeisPower**

Share your knowledge and experience with new team members! We strongly believe in consistent training and development of our teams. Many of our success stories started their careers from being part of our store teams and have grown to be future District Managers, Sales Directors, HQ Department positions and beyond!

**Be a part of the Calzedonia USA story and make your mark!**

**JOB REQUIREMENTS** 

* Eligibility to work in the US for any Employer
* High School graduate or equivalent
* Minimum 4 years of experience in customer service and contemporary retail industry preferred
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Commitment, being self-motivated and goal oriented
* Problem solving
* Ability to manage a large team
* You are able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, holidays and weekends
* You are a people person! Working with a team to accomplish store goals, genuinely enjoying an environment of fun music and building connections with our guests for the best shopping experience.
* You are able to lift in excess of 20 pounds and stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, fora short distance engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance including climbing a ladder and use a step stool

* Medical Insurance

* Paid Parental Leave\\*Must meet eligibility requirements

* Pre-Tax commuter benefits for transit and parking (Depending on City/State)

title: Nanny
description:
***Ridgewood, NJ Family! (#7221)***

**Looking for Nanny to Start:** *Sept 9th!*

$25+ per hour*+ PAID Vacation, PAID Holidays & PAID Sick Days!*

***Mornings are FREE! HOUSEHOLD Manager / Nanny!*** **Monday to Friday:** 2:00pm to 7:00pm

**10 year old girl:** She loves all things Taylor Swift and anything creative - baking, art, science. She is a busy 5th grader with school activities, soccer, gymnastics, lacrosse and basketball. She is on the quieter side but will come out of her shell under the care of loving, supportive, fun adults in her life. She warms up quickly to new people. She makes friends her age everywhere she goes! She loves school! She walks to school when the weather is nice and is driven to and from school when the weather is bad. Her favorite foods are pizza, pasta, fruit, bagels, and rice. Lunch at school is a mix of packed lunch and ordering school lunch. No foods to avoid other than dairy which she is slightly sensitive to. She does not have any health concerns or require any medications.

**8 year old boy:** He is a very active 3rd grader. He has a lot of energy and loves to harness that energy doing anything game related - soccer, basketball, lacrosse, chess, and Yahtzee! He is very outgoing but can be shy with new people at first. He relates easily to his peers but also charms most adults he meets! His favorite foods are bagels, pizza, chicken nuggets, fruit, and yogurt. Mix of packed and bought lunch for school days. No foods off limits although vegetables are not his favorite to eat! He does not have any allergies, food restrictions, or medications.

**4 year old boy:** He can take a bit to warm up but as soon as you get to his level - he’ll be your friend for life. He loves puzzles, building with Legos, playing with dinosaurs and his paw patrol characters! His favorite foods are rice, eggs, protein bars, waffles, and yogurt! He is on a sleep schedule and is in bed by 7pm. He doesn't have any known allergies or health concerns!

**Schedule:** The ideal start date would be September 9th, 2024! Some flexibility would be nice to have. Mom works from home full time. Dad goes into the office on some days and works from home on other days of the week. The nanny is not needed to stay overnight; however, the family would be open to discuss travelling together in the future! The nanny will be needed for transportation to activities and school pick up. She can utilize the family vehicle while on duty! The family is open to discuss payroll vs. cash.

**Wishes:** Someone who is responsible, reliable, flexible, and professional. Someone willing to do light housekeeping. A nanny who is patient and provides love, support, structure, and fun!

***Requirements:***  
\\*Must be willing to commit to a minimum of 1 year of employment.  
\\*Must have 3 solid childcare references that are able to be verified.  
\\*Must be willing to submit to Drug Testing & Criminal background checks.  
\\*Must have a driver's license and a good driving record.  
\\*Must have a reliable vehicle for the position.

title: Associate Editor, Crime
description:
Job Title
Associate Editor, Crime
Job Description
I. Job Summary | The Associate Editor will be a hybrid writer and editor responsible for working closely with the Senior Editor, Crime and Senior News Editor, Crime to generate stories for the vertical for content across platforms. This will include a mix of writing, reporting and editing, as well as helping to lead digital coverage of key events, police investigations and trials, developing and implementing digital coverage strategy, and managing both routine daily news and breaking news situations. This candidate is a dynamic editor who knows how to find unique and compelling stories, a solid line editor and headline writer with sound news judgment and an ability to prioritize stories as they come in from all angles, working cleanly and quickly under tight deadlines. The candidate also needs to be able to ideate and identify key second-beat and breakout opportunities on breaking news and true crime stories trending on social media. It is key to have a fluent understanding of the digital landscape, including content streams, SEO and analytics, and to be meticulously organized. The Associate Editor may also be called upon to assist with breaking news and event coverage during nights and weekends.  

II. Essential Job Functions
Weight *%*
Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results
40%
Finding, assigning and editing digital stories. Working with the legal team on story review.  

30%
Strategizing and coordinating coverage, making assignments and overseeing execution, drawing on the editorial calendar as well as data and analytics. Assisting in developing sources and long-term reporting initiatives.  

20%
Writing and reporting.  

10%
Preparing for news moments ahead of time, and other duties as assigned.
III. Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements | *All must be met to be considered.*
Education:
BA or BS, preferably in journalism or communications, related field or equivalent training and/or equivalent work experience
Experience:
Minimum 4 years experience working in a high volume, digital news operation
Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:* A strategic thinker with a proven track record of creating content that increases traffic and engagement by using an analytics-driven approach.
* Strong writing and editing skills, impeccable journalistic standards and attention to detail.
* Ability to respond quickly to breaking news and juggle multiple projects and priorities.
* Experience with SEO, content management systems and analytics.
* An idea generator who can think of new, fresh ways to package content.
* Excellent people skills and the ability to work with anybody: this role requires liaising with different departments.
* Sound news judgment and knowledge of the PEOPLE brand.


% Travel Required *(Approximate)*: not anticipated, but may be assigned

description:
Join Bob’s Sales Team: Enhance Shopping Experiences, Grow Your Career!

#Mybobsjobs #sales #fun

Looking for a workplace that offers more than just a job? At Bob’s, we understand you have choices, which is why we're committed to providing exceptional opportunities for career growth alongside a vibrant and team-oriented environment with fantastic benefits! Our benefits go beyond just earnings and incentives. Enjoy comprehensive health and wellness packages, paid time off, employee discounts, and more. We're committed to supporting your well-being both at work and at home.

title: Assistant Store Manager - Intimissimi at one of our Manhattan, NYC locations ($24-$27)
description:
Intimissimi is searching for a passionate Assistant Store Manager for one of our Manhattan, NYC locations!

**THE ROLE** 

Our Assistant Store Managers play a crucial role in supporting the Store Manager to ensure the efficient and successful operation of the store. You are responsible for creating a positive and productive work environment while maintaining a high level of customer service. You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills which combined with strong leadership abilities can motivate and guide the Team.

**LIFE OF THE ASSISTANT STORE MANAGER** 

An Assistant Store Manager is someone who has passion for retail, a dedicated, motivated, and customer-oriented individual with a strong sense of responsibility and accountability who thrives in a fast-paced environment and promotes teamwork and open communication among staff. You always demonstrate Oniverse’s Key Values: Open Minded, Authentic, Passionate, Dynamic, Team Player, Pragmatic!

**Open Minded:** Open to learning and receiving guidance and feedback from store leadership. You embrace new ideas, are receptive to customer feedback, and approach challenges with a willingness to explore innovative solutions. You understand the diverse needs and preferences of guests and colleagues, fostering an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere within the store. You actively engage with guests, adapt to ever-changing trends, ensuring a personalized shopping experience.

**Authentic:** Be real! Honesty is key and always working together with integrity. Assistant Store Managers embody genuineness and sincerity. You enjoy authentically connecting with guests, sharing your passion for the brand while fostering loyal and long-lasting relationships with guests and colleagues. #WeAreOne We support and encourage a respectful and inclusive team atmosphere by welcoming Diversity, Inclusion and Equity for all team members and guests.

**Passionate:** Share your excitement and promote brand loyalty with guests and store team. As an Assistant Store Manager you have firsthand experience with new fashion collections and can share newness with all guests. Share your passion for INTIMISSIMI by building brand loyalty with each guest!

Your goal is ensuring each guest has a memorable experience in our shops.

**Dynamic:** Assistant Store Managers thrive in a fast-paced environment, embracing change and adaptability. You will be able to navigate busy hours, responding with care to guests’ inquiries and requests, supporting with visuals updates, assisting with stock management practices, and overall contributing to a seamless shopping experience for guests and efficient environment for colleagues.

**Team Player:** We are all in this together! Our Assistant Store Managers believe in teamwork through all day-to-day activities to ensure high quality experience for guests, but also supporting each other every step of the way. You collaborate effectively with colleagues, fostering a positive and cooperative atmosphere in the shop. Being part of the INTIMISSIMI means lending a helping hand to colleagues, being a mentor for new colleagues, creating a unified and motivated network that delivers high quality guest experience.

**Pragmatic:** You are a problem solver! You approach challenges with practicality and resourcefulness, finding effective solutions together with your colleagues and store leadership that align with the store’s goals and guests’ needs. Always balancing creativity and efficiency, while following company policies and procedures.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES** 

Sales and Performance Management:

* Assist in the execution of marketing initiatives and promotional events to drive customer traffic and increase brand awareness.
* Provide regular updates to the Store Manager on store performance, sales figures, and customer feedback.
* Collaborate with the Store Manager and corporate teams to share insights and contribute to the store's overall improvement.
* Perform in a consistent, timely and effective manner in accordance with established company and department specific policies and procedures.
* Lead by example and coach the store team to deliver outstanding service, ensuring that every customer feels valued and satisfied with their shopping experience.
* Collaborate with the Store Manager to set sales targets and goals for the store and actively participate in achieving them.
* Monitor sales performance, analyze key performance indicators (KPIs), and take proactive measures to drive sales and maximize revenue.

Staff Training and Development

* Utilize retail training material according to company and brand strategies.
* Ensure each team member takes part in chat-ins at the start of their shifts and before leaving for the day.
* Delegate according to individual’s knowledge and skill set to effectively achieve results.
* Assist the Store Manager in training and developing the store team, ensuring they have the necessary product knowledge, sales techniques, and customer service skills.
* Conduct regular coaching sessions and provide feedback to team members to enhance their performance and professional growth.

Operations

* Help oversee daily store operations, including opening and closing procedures, cash handling, and managing store facilities.
* Work with the Store Manager to ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and safety regulations.
* Support the Store Manager in maintaining the store's visual merchandising standards, ensuring that displays are attractive, organized, and aligned with brand guidelines.
* Participate in store layout changes and seasonal updates to create an engaging and inviting shopping environment.
* Assist in managing store inventory, including stock replenishment, stockroom organization, and conducting regular stock checks.
* Collaborate with the Store Manager to ensure optimal stock levels to meet customer demand while minimizing stock discrepancies.
* Store Cleanliness: at our stores, we take great pride in providing our customers with a clean and well-maintained shopping environment. This includes the cleanliness and organization of the store: including but not limited to the salesfloor, fitting rooms, cash desk area, and backroom areas such as bathroom and stockroom. As a retail employee, you are expected to take the initiative of upkeeping the cleanliness in the store.

Teams will be required to conduct daily cleaning tasks included but not limited to:

* Dust and clean shelves, furniture, fixtures and decor
* Clean doors, window glass, mirrors (exterior and interior)
* Pick up and empty trash cans and garbage taking it to the dumpster as needed
* Sweep and mop hard floors
* Wipe and sanitize sinks, countertops, shared common areas and equipment

TEAM DYNAMIC

* Liaison between Store Leads, Sales Ambassadors, and Store Management to ensure clients experience high quality customer service, completing store operations efficiently and implementing sales strategies thus meeting and exceeding commercial goals.
* Provides training to Store Leads and Sales Ambassadors, may include cross-department functions.
* Based on your experience with the INTIMISSIMI and performance, you may be selected to support NEW Stores Openings across the US as a team bonding opportunity and a chance to put your skills and knowledge to the test!
* Participate in nationwide contests within other INTIMISSIMI locations to show our team spirit!

**CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES** 

All Assistant Store Managers get the chance to learn new skills daily. We believe in hands-on experience training in different store functions to develop an entrepreneur mindset and spirit, such as: Guest Experience, Basic Store Operations, Business Acumen, Visuals Merchandising, Stock Management, and much more!

#TeamworkMakesTheDreamWork

We are all team players! Our leaders always encourage development between team members to support professional growth.

#KnowledgeisPower

Share your knowledge and experience with new team members! We strongly believe in consistent training and development of our teams. Many of our success stories started their careers from being part of our store teams and have grown to be future Store Managers, District Managers, Sales Directors and beyond!

**Be a part of the Calzedonia USA story and make your mark!**

**JOB REQUIREMENTS** 

* Eligibility to work in the US for any Employer
* You are able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, holidays and weekends
* You are a people person! Working with a team to accomplish store goals, genuinely enjoying an environment of fun music and building connections with our guests for the best shopping experience.
* You are able to lift in excess of 20 pounds and stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, for a short distance engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance including climbing a ladder and use a step stool

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**We’re Hiring: Graphic Designer at Guaranteed Service!** 

Are you a creative visionary with a passion for design? Do you have an eye for detail and a knack for bringing ideas to life through visual storytelling? If so, we want to hear from you!

**Position:** Graphic Designer  
**Location:** Manasquan, NJ

**Company:** Guaranteed Service

**About Us:**  
At Guaranteed Service, we pride ourselves on delivering top-notch home services, including plumbing, heating, cooling, and electrical solutions. We’re looking for a talented Graphic Designer to join our dynamic marketing team and help us elevate our brand to new heights!

**What You’ll Do:**

* Create visually compelling designs for digital and print materials, including social media graphics, email campaigns, brochures, and website content.
* Collaborate with our marketing team to develop innovative design concepts that align with our brand identity.
* Produce high-quality visual content for promotional campaigns, advertisements, and other marketing initiatives.
* Maintain and enhance our brand’s visual consistency across all channels.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* Proven experience as a Graphic Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) and other design tools.
* Strong understanding of visual hierarchy, typography, color theory, and layout design.
* Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
* A creative thinker who can bring fresh ideas to the table and work collaboratively with a team.

**Why Join Us?**

* Be part of a growing company that values creativity and innovation.

title: Assistant Director of Nursing
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Kings County Hospital Center has a rich legacy for its pioneering role in medicine. Today, with over 625 beds, our hospital remains on the cutting edge of technology and provides the most modern procedures with state-of-the-art equipment. Built in 1831 as a one room infirmary for publicly supported care of the sick, Kings County Hospital Center continues to be a leading healthcare facility whose mission is to provide care to everyone regardless of their ability to pay. The hospital provides a wide range of health services, and specialties are offered in all fields of modern medicine. More than 200 clinics provide a wide array of ambulatory care services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


**Tour II: 8:00 A.M – 4:00 P.M**

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**Purpose of Position**


Under the supervision of Director of Nursing Quality and Performance Improvement or designee, the Assistant Director of ED Nursing Quality serves an integral part of the nursing leadership team who ensures that standards of nursing practice are in alignment with the organizational, regulatory, and nationally recognized professional standards, and evidence-based practice. The Assistant Director of ED Nursing Quality is instrumental in implementing and evaluating Nursing Quality and Performance Improvement (PI) activities and ED-specific PI projects.

**Areas of Responsibility**




Nursing Quality and Performance Improvement and ED Nursing Dept.

**Summary of Duties and Responsibilities**




* Monitors nurse-sensitive/quality indicators and projects for ED Nursing Department
* Assists and evaluates nursing performance improvement activities and ED-specific PI projects to ensure quality and appropriateness of care, patient safety, and compliance with regulatory standards
* Develops and maintains nursing quality indicator databases
* Coordinates the collection of data with ED ADNs or designee; Aggregates, analyzes, and extrapolates quality indicators data and transforms them into actionable information; Assists ED in the implementation of corrective actions and in evaluating results/outcomes
* Prepares monthly/quarterly nursing quality indicator reports, displaying performance in forms of graphs, scorecards, or story boards.
* Disseminates and interprets nursing quality indicators and National Database of Nursing Quality Indicators (NDNQI) reports to ED leadership, and works closely with ED nursing leaders and staff to guide them in the identification, planning, implementation, and evaluation of performance improvement initiatives
* Assists Director of Nursing for Quality with monthly, quarterly, and annual ED quality/performance/improvement reports to present at various committees
* Provides Nursing Quality/PI orientation to newly hired nursing staff in ED
* Coordinates with NDNQI coordinator ED’s nurse-sensitive indicators for data entry to NDNQI database
* Ensures accurate data collection and submission of selected monitored indicators
* Adheres to RN survey data collection protocol
* Assists in readiness of announced and unannounced regulatory agency visits and participates in various regulatory agency surveys
* Participates in nursing quality council meetings, grand rounds and nursing peer reviews
* Participates in nursing policies, procedures, and standards revision
* Liaises with Risk Management Department on nursing quality risk reduction monitoring and reporting; Assists in investigating patient safety concerns and incidents to include debriefings and assists in the implementation of corrective action plans
* Interfaces with Quality Management Department on nursing quality improvement concerns and participates in hospital-wide quality improvement teams
* Participates in departmental and hospital-wide committee meetings
* Enforces with staff I-CARE (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) values/principles in providing patient care
* Promotes a culture of engagement where staff thrive and contributes to positive patient/family experience
* Maintains familiarity and remains up-to-date with regulatory agency standards
* Continuously strives to increase core knowledge and role competency through leadership development activities
* Performs other related duties, as directed

**Pathway to Excellence**

* Plays a significant role in planning, scheduling, organizing, implementing, and operationalizing Pathway to Excellence Program in ED
* Knowledgeable with the six (6) Pathway to Excellence standards and the different elements of performance
* Engages staff in practicing the standards of Pathway to Excellence program
* Fosters the foundation of collaboration among staff and supports a shared-governance environment
* Encourages participation of staff in shared governance committees
* Actively engages staff for discussion and inputs on resource allocation and cost management
* Supports staff during times of organizational change or change in leadership
* Promotes a culture of day-to-day recognition
* Participates in peer-to-peer performance feedback/review and uses these feedback as opportunities for improvement

**Shared Governance**

* Assists DON for Nursing Quality in organizing and guiding ED nursing shared governance council


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a professional nurse in New York State, plus (2) or (3), below.  

  

2. Masters Degree in Nursing Administration, Education, Clinical Specialty or equivalent field and five years of satisfactory nursing experience, of which three years shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity; or a Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing and six years of satisfactory nursing experience, four years of which shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity.  

  

3. A satisfactory equivalent of education and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------

  


**Knowledge and skills:**


Leadership, management, communication, coaching, counseling, problem solving, decision making, and conflict resolution.

**Years of Experience:**


Minimum of two to three years ED clinical nursing experience; and


Minimum of two to three years Nursing Quality experience.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the **"Apply Now"** button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: EVV-Electronic Visit Verification Specialist
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**Electronic Visit Verification Specialist** 

**POSITION DESCRIPTION:** BRIDGES operates a variety of programs guided by the philosophy of Independent Living to provide services and supports for individuals with disabilities so that they may experience autonomy in all areas of living.

BRIDGES acts as a Fiscal Intermediary in a NY State Agency with Choice model, that allows people with disabilities to recruit, interview, hire, train and dismiss their own worker known as a Personal Assistant (PA). The Electronic Visit Verification (EVV) Specialist is responsible for the monitoring of real time service delivery being provided in the home of BRIDGES Consumers across the state of New York. The EVV Specialist will ensure accurate biweekly payroll processing for all Personal Assistants that work in the field by utilizing the HHA Exchange database system. The EVV Specialist will be the point of contact for all time and attendance and payroll discrepancies. The EVV Specialist must work in accordance with Medicaid guidelines for the CDPA program as well as BRIDGES policies.

**QUALIFICATIONS:** 

● Associates preferred. High school diploma or equivalent required and/or three years paid or volunteer experience in Human Services or completion.

● Two years of homecare or healthcare experience or experience in healthcare or service-related industry preferred.

● Bilingual preferred but not required.

● Good interpersonal, organizational, written, and oral communication skills.; Treats people with respect, and sensitivity for cultural differences.

● Ability to interact with co-workers, clients, volunteers, and other agency staff, as well as the public in a professional and courteous manner.

● Maintain strong work ethic and strict adherence to code of ethics, standards of conduct, and confidentiality requirements-

● Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Outlook Mail, Outlook Calendar, Excel, g-mail and g-docs

● Ability to become proficient on other software products as utilized by the position.

● Complies with federal, state, and local financial legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation, enforcing adherence to requirements, and advising management on needed actions.

● Must be able to maintain solid documentation and record keeping.

● Strong computer skills with attention to detail.

● Maintains strict confidentiality and protects Agency operations by keeping information confidential and secure.

● Establishes and maintains a strong attention to detail, ensuring work is accurate and complete, and adheres to all established deadlines.

● Excellent interpersonal, active listening, observation, analytical, problem-recognition and problem-solving skills.

● Familiarity with CDPA or HHA Exchange is strongly preferred

● Daily monitoring of EVV dashboard and troubleshooting potential issues.

● Linking calls to appropriate consumer profiles.

● Contacting consumers/representatives and/or PAs as necessary to investigate missed calls, phone number errors overlapping shifts, missed calls etc.

● Maintain calls on EVV dashboard and ensure all calls are linked to process payroll.

● Ensure all calls are linked and schedules are made for each EVV call made.

● Review PAs over and/or underutilization of hours for payroll weeks and making adjustments prior to payroll being processed.

● Generate all necessary EVV reports weekly to identify any PAs that have over utilized hours.

● Works closely with Billing Specialists/Authorization Specialists to correct any billing discrepancies due to improperly scheduled or over utilized units.

● Ensure any prebilling visits are cleared prior to the payroll week and document missed visits if needed.

● Troubleshooting any problems, concerns difficulties PAs are experiencing with the EVV system and escalating all concerns to the Assistant Director of CDPA or the Director of Home Care Services if needed.

● Perform other specific tasks related to the department as assigned.

● All responsibilities for this position should be carried out with the Mission and Goals of the agency in mind; including interactions with people who come to us for assistance, members of the public, representatives from other agencies and county offices, as well as with co-workers in daily office functioning.

● Attend professional development (webinars, workshops, conferences, etc.) to advance knowledge on related programs/activities of the organization as requested by the employee or the Director.

title: Prevention Education Program Manager
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:** The Program Manager for Prevention Education will oversee the planning, implementation, and evaluation of programs and services. This role involves managing a team of program staff, ensuring compliance with funding requirements, tracking program performance, and fostering partnerships with community stakeholders. The Program Manager will play a crucial role in advancing the organization's mission, ensuring the delivery of high-quality services, and driving program growth and sustainability.

**EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS:** 

**MINIMUM:** Bachelor’s degree in teaching, psychology, social work or related fields.  
**MINIMUM:** 4 years of supervisory a team of 4 or more experience required.

MINIMUM: Two (2) years of Non-Profit Management/ Allocating funding Experience required

Bilingual English-speaking candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. (Spanish and Haitian-Creole preferred)

**LICENSURE:**  NYS Driver’s license preferred.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Supervision and Leadership**

* Supervise and provide weekly trauma-informed supervision to front-line health workers, including Health Educators, Care Specialists, Senior Counselors, Lead Navigators/Navigators, and other assigned staff.
* Provide weekly individual supervision and biweekly group supervision to staff and assigned interns.
* Responsible for the overall implementation and management of the OASAS contracts.
* Allocate nonprofit contracts, track, and report metrics to stakeholders, and ensure timely achievement of deliverables.
* Actively participate in the recruitment, onboarding, training, and performance management of supervised positions.
* Educate staff on data collection, documentation, and reporting protocols.
* Perform daily chart reviews and periodic group observations to ensure quality service delivery.
* Utilize weekly electronic health record reports to measure program deliverables, ensure data accuracy, and provide constructive feedback.
* Supervise outreach, street outreach, and groups.
* Review, develop, and implement departmental policies and procedures.

**Assessments and Patient Data Collection**

* Ensure that all client assessments and service plans are thorough, client-centered, and completed on time.
* Conduct and supervise intakes, assessments, and treatment plans. Assign cases and tasks as needed.
* Supervise program staff and complete all required monthly and other reports.
* Ensure all services are provided in a culturally and linguistically appropriate manner.
* Lead the collection of post-program patient data and surveys.

**Program Coordination and Outreach**

* Participate in department and program meetings, including Weekly Team Meetings, Monthly Tenant Meetings, etc.
* Effectively use tools such as safety plans, community meetings, psycho-education groups, team meetings, red flag reviews, treatment planning conferences, and self-care to create a nonviolent and trauma-sensitive culture.
* Allocate up to 25% of your role to participating in outreach efforts.
* Work with the Marketing and Communications Team to develop targeted messages that increase client engagement and promote activities and events.

**Other Responsibilities**

* Other duties as assigned based on program needs.
* Duties may be outside regular work hours and may include evenings and weekends when needed.
* May serve as a backup driver for the agency mobile unit.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:**

* Expertise in Evidence-Based Interventions and Practices, such as Motivational Interviewing and Strengthening Families.
* Ability to identify system performance measures and implement strategies to enhance staff engagement and performance.
* Strong proficiency in using electronic health record (EHR) systems, with project management, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
* Independently handles responsibilities within the prevention field, utilizing deep knowledge of sexual risk and trauma impacts on diverse communities.
* Skilled in working with culturally diverse populations and willing to work flexible hours as required.

title: Sonographer
description:
**Sonographer Job Description**

**Objectives**

To reach out to women and men experiencing unplanned pregnancy with the mercy and compassion of Jesus Christ by offering emotional, spiritual, and practical support in both word and action - primarily through performing ultrasound exams on abortion vulnerable clients.

Reports to: Director of Health Services, or Center Director, in DHS’s absence

**Qualifications:**

1. Identify with the Christian faith, attend a church, and align to our statement of faith.

2. A regular attender/member in good standing of a local Bible-believing church.

3. Exhibit strong commitment and dedication to the sanctity of human life and sexual activity within the confines of marriage.

4. Full agreement with and willingness to uphold the Statements of Faith and Principle and policies of First Choice.

5. Dependable, stable, and capable of following through on commitments.

6. A sincere desire to reach out with the love of Jesus to people in distress.

7. Knowledge of scripture, especially pertaining to the sanctity of life, forgiveness, sexual purity and salvation.

8. Ability to respect confidentiality.

9. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and basic computer operations.

10. Completion of First Choice’s volunteer training seminar and in-house peer-counselor training.

11. For all who have experienced abortion, completion of AASC and approval to serve clients by AASC coordinator.

12. RDMS-OB certified.

13. Current CPR/BLS certification.

14. Proof of most recent TB test.

15. Proof of MMR and HBV vaccination.

**Skills:**

Basic Skills

1. Active Learning - Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

2. Active Listening - Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

3. Critical Thinking - Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.

4. Learning Strategies - Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures

appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

5. Monitoring - Monitoring/assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.

6. Reading Comprehension - Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work-related

documents.

7. Speaking - Talking to others to convey information effectively.

**Social Skills**

1. Coordination - Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

2. Instructing - Teaching others how to do something.

3. Service Orientation - Actively looking for ways to help people.

4. Social Perceptiveness – Being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

Technical Skills

1.Operation Monitoring - Watching dials or other indicators to make sure a machine is working

properly.

Resource Management Skills

1. Time Management - Managing one's own time and time appointments with clients.

Desktop Computer Skills

1. Navigation - Using scroll bars, a mouse, and dialog boxes to work within the computer's operating system. Being able to access and switch between applications and files of interest.

Responsibilities:

1. To provide ultrasound exams for each client in an atmosphere of warmth and compassion through listening and other helping skills.

2. To provide accurate information and education on abortion, sexual health, and prenatal care.

3. To follow all policies and procedures regarding ultrasound, counseling, helpline, and office flow-through.

4. To offer counsel, material resources and referrals appropriate to a clients’ situation.

5. To look for teachable moments with a client in order to share the love of Jesus and His plan of salvation.

6. To appropriately follow-up clients according to the policies and guidelines of the Center.

7. In scans, identify heartbeat, crown rump length and gestational sac.

Paperwork:

1. To read and follow all office procedures.

2. To keep up-to-date on statistics and information relating to ultrasound techniques, pregnancy, abortion, sexual health and adoption through in-services; magazines; journals; and newspaper articles.

3. To keep current on the information in the First Choice Women’s Resource Centers referral book.

4. To record all client contact on the client Intake Forms and in Client Services computer program.

* Paid time off

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Microsoft Office: 2 years (Preferred)
* ministry: 2 years (Preferred)

title: Stock Associate (Full-Time) Intimissimi at one of our Manhattan locations ($18-$21)
description:
**Intimissimi is searching for passionate Full-time Stock Assciate at one of its Manhattan locations in New York City, NY!**

**THE ROLE** 

The Stock Associate is a crucial role for the store: highly organized with an expertise in fashion always representing the Oniverse Key values: Open Mind, Passion, Pragmatism, Teamwork and Goal Orientation.

**LIFE OF THE STOCK ASSOCIATE** 

The Stock Associate focuses on providing a superior level of Stockroom organization, while constantly supporting the Sales Floor based off business needs and coverage to drive business revenue and inspire others. The Stock Associate will work independently and will report to the Boutique’s Manager. The Stock Associate will focus mainly on all stockroom related activities such as shipment, merchandise allocation, returns while supporting the Sales Floor with daily replenishment, backstock, constantly providing a high-level of professionalism. The Stock Associate role requires a positive, detailed-oriented, outgoing, and engaging personality, always demonstrating a collaborative open mindset towards daily challenges. The Stock Associate demonstrates high-level of organization to accomplish stockroom daily activities, following guidelines always demonstrating a proactive attitude and willing to work on a flexible schedule.

Be a mentor for your Teammates! You always demonstrate Oniverse’s Key Values: Open Minded, Authentic, Passionate, Dynamic, Team Player, Pragmatic!

**OPEN MINDED**: Open to learning and receiving guidance and feedback from store leadership. You embrace new ideas, are receptive to Managers feedback, and approach challenges with a willingness to explore innovative solutions. You understand the diverse needs and preferences of colleagues, fostering an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere within the store. You actively engage with all team members adapt to ever-changing trends.

**AUTHENTIC**: Be real! Honesty is key and always working together with integrity. Stock Associates embody genuineness and sincerity. You enjoy authentically connecting with people, sharing your passion for the brand while fostering loyal and long-lasting relationships with guests and colleagues. **#WeAreOne** We support and encourage a respectful and inclusive team atmosphere by welcoming Diversity, Inclusion and Equity for all team members and guests.

**PASSIONATE**: Share your excitement and promote brand loyalty with guests and store team. As a Stock Associate you have firsthand experience with new fashion collections and can share newness with all Team members.

**DYNAMIC**: Stock Associates thrive in a fast-paced environment, embracing change and adaptability. You will be able to navigate busy hours, responding with care to colleagues’ inquiries and requests, supporting with new arrivals updates, assisting with stock management practices, and overall contributing to a seamless shopping experience for guests and efficient environment for colleagues.

**TEAM PLAYER**: We are all in this together! Our Stock Associates believe in teamwork through all day-to-day activities to ensure high quality experience for guests, but also supporting each other every step of the way. You collaborate effectively with colleagues, fostering a positive and cooperative atmosphere in the shop. Being part of Calzedonia means lending a helping hand to colleagues, being a mentor for new colleagues, creating a unified and motivated network that delivers high quality guest experience.

**PRAGMATIC**: You are a problem solver! You approach challenges with practicality and resourcefulness, finding effective solutions together with your colleagues and store leadership that align with the store’s goals and guests’ needs. Always balancing creativity and efficiency, while following company policies and procedures.

**KEY REPONSIBILITIES** 

* Build genuine relationships with all Team members through clear and consistent communication
* Demonstrate a positive and proactive attitude in every situation to constantly raise the level of service provided and consistently exceed expectations
* Demonstrate strong verbal, written communication and organization skills
* Be responsible for all Stockroom related activities, including but not limited to shipment, pickers organization and Sales Floor responsibilities assigned time to time by the Store Manager based off business needs and coverage
* Achieve and exceed personal productivity goals agreed upon with your Store Manager
* Demonstrate a full knowledge of the product to support team members on the Sales Floor when needed
* Build collaborative partnerships in a team-focused environment
* Supporting managers in maximizing efficiency in executing standard in-store operations, such as daily replenishment, backstock and processing of seasonal markdowns, returns
* Partnering with the Manager to leverage knowledge of internal systems to conduct business analyses.
* Supporting managers in maintaining the visual and housekeeping standards of the store, stockroom included
* Store Cleanliness: at our stores, we take great pride in providing our customers with a clean and well-maintained shopping environment. This includes the cleanliness and organization of the store: including but not limited to the salesfloor, fitting rooms, cash desk area, and backroom areas such as bathroom and stockroom. As a retail employee, you are expected to take the initiative of upkeeping the cleanliness in the store. Teams will be required to conduct daily cleaning tasks included but not limited to:
* Dust and clean shelves, furniture, fixtures and decor
* Clean doors, window glass, mirrors (exterior and interior)
* Pick up and empty trash cans and garbage taking it to the dumpster as needed
* Sweep and mop hard floors
* Wipe and sanitize sinks, countertops, shared common areas and equipment

**TEAM DYNAMIC** 

* Report directly to Store Management to ensure all stockroom operations are conducted efficiently, constantly implementing organization and efficiency
* Based on your experience with Calzedonia and performance, you may be selected to support New Stores Openings across the US as a team bonding opportunity and a chance to put your skills and knowledge to the test!
* Participate in nationwide contests within other Calzedonia locations to show our team spirit!

**CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES** 

All Stock associates get the chance to learn new skills daily. We believe in hands-on experience training in different store functions to develop an entrepreneur mindset and spirit, such as: Guest Experience, Basic Store Operations, Business Acumen, Visuals Merchandising, Stock Management, and much more!

**#TeamworkMakesTheDreamWork** 

We are all team players! Our leaders always encourage development between team members to support professional growth.

**#Knowledgeispower** 

Share your knowledge and experience with new team members! We strongly believe in consistent training and development of our teams. Many of our success stories started their careers from being part of our store teams and have grown to be future Store Managers, District Managers, Sales Directors and beyond!

**Be a part of the Calzedonia USA story and make your mark!**

**JOB REQUIREMENTS** 

* Eligibility to work in the US for any Employer
* High School graduate or equivalent
* Minimum 2-5 years of experience in a contemporary retail industry setting including
* Ability to work independently
* Organized individual

Stockroom and Sales Floor responsibilities

* Experience in processing shipment weekly
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Previous Supervisor experience is a plus
* Commitment, being self-motivated and detail-oriented
* Problem solving and highly organized
* You are able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, holidays and weekends subject to change according to business needs
* You are a people person! Working with a team to accomplish store goals, genuinely enjoying an environment of fun music and constructive criticism
* You are able to lift in excess of 20 pounds and stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) including moving boxes and technical materials.

**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS PACKAGE** 

* Base Salary based on experience
* Medical Insurance
* Pet Insurance
* Paid Time off
* Paid Parental Leave\\*Must meet eligibility requirements
* 401(K) matching
* Pre-Tax commuter benefits for transit and parking
* Sign on Bonus
* Referral bonus
* Employee Discount
* Free Uniform, and so much more!

**Accelerate your skills and build a foundation for your career!**

title: Payroll Operations Manager
description:
**Join Our Team!**
Are you a detail-oriented payroll professional with a passion for accuracy and efficiency? Do you thrive in a dynamic university environment and enjoy the challenge of building something from the ground up? If so, we want to hear from you!**About Us:**
Located on a beautiful, wooded campus in northern New Jersey, you will find a thriving small town less than an hour from New York City. Our Human Resources team supports a vibrant and diverse campus community. Our community values mentoring, thoughtful engagement, and lifelong personal and professional growth, and we're looking for a Payroll Operations Manager who shares our dedication to these principles.**Position Overview:**
As the Payroll Operations Manager, you will play a pivotal role in managing our payroll processes and ensuring timely and accurate payrolls. But that’s not all—you will also have the unique opportunity to lead the implementation of a new ERP payroll solution, helping us build a first-class payroll operation from the ground up. You’ll collaborate with a wide range of university stakeholders, from faculty and staff to students and external partners, all while ensuring compliance with federal, state, and university regulations.  

The Payroll Operations Manager is responsible for ensuring the accurate and timely processing of payroll and maintaining the integrity of HRIS systems for the university. This role requires strong attention to detail, a deep understanding of payroll processes and regulations, and effective communication skills to ensure seamless payroll operations and compliance with all legal requirements. The Payroll Operations Manager will also play a key role in fostering positive relationships, implementing policies, and driving process improvements across the university.
### **Key Responsibilities**

+ Prepare and process accurate, timely, and compliant payrolls on a bi-weekly basis.
+ Assist with the implementation and maintenance of all payroll-related functions in the Banner system.
+ Manage payroll-related computer system issues, including training, reporting, problem-solving, and proposing enhancements.
+ Ensure the integrity of data within the university's HR and payroll systems.
+ Ensure compliance with federal, state, and university payroll policies, guidelines, and procedures.
+ Process, pay, and reconcile employee optional benefits such as retirement, union dues, health savings accounts, and other benefits.
+ Prepare and submit required federal, state, and union reports.
+ Manage garnishments, including processing payments after payrolls are completed.
+ Establish controls, monitor results, and collaborate with University Technology to modify programming, processes, and reporting in compliance with federal and state laws.
+ Ensure timely completion of all payroll tax reporting requirements and issuance of W-2s and W-2Cs. Respond to audit requests as needed.
+ Provide best practices guidance as required.

### **Core Competencies**

+ Comprehensive knowledge of HR practices, including recruitment, training, compensation, labor relations, and personnel information systems, with expertise in ADP or Banner.
+ Proficiency in payroll systems such as ADP, Banner, Colleague, and advanced Excel skills.
+ Strong oral and written communication skills, enabling clear and effective interaction with stakeholders.
+ Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships with diverse stakeholders, including faculty, staff, and students.
+ Excellent planning, organization, and coordination skills to manage payroll operations effectively.
+ Customer service orientation, with a focus on problem-solving and service excellence.
+ Ability to multitask and maintain attention to detail to ensure accurate and timely payroll processing.
+ Discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information.

### **Required Qualifications**

+ Bachelor's degree or 4 years of equivalent experience in payroll administration and processing.
+ A minimum of 2 years of payroll processing experience.
+ Knowledge of federal, state, and local laws and regulations governing employee compensation.
+ Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize tasks while working both collaboratively and independently.

### **Preferred Qualifications**

+ Experience processing payroll in the higher education sector.
+ Expertise in ADP payroll systems.

$65,000 - $75,000 a year
The estimated base salary range for this job is $65,000 - $75,000. The range represents a good faith estimate of the range that CampusWorks reasonably expects to pay for this job at the time of the job posting. The actual salary paid to an individual will vary based on multiple factors, including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; required travel; and other business, contractual, and organizational needs.

This job is also eligible to participate in CampusWorks’ annual profit-sharing program, which reflects CampusWorks’ pay for performance philosophy. The job is also eligible to participate in CampusWorks’ generous benefit offerings, which include medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k retirement plan, and other health and wellness plans.

The salary range information provided is in accordance with applicable state and local laws regarding salary transparency that are currently in effect and may be implemented in the future.

title: Group Facilitator
description:
**Wellness Recovery Center is an Outpatient Substance Abuse Treatment Center fairly new to Mercer County. We are located in West Windsor, NJ, our facility offers traditional & holistic methods for treating substance abuse in a Partial Hospitalization (PHP) and Intensive Outpatient (IOP) setting.**

**WRC is looking to hire a Group Facilitator to join the team! There are full-time and part-time positions available.**

The group facilitator plans and implements weekly program groups that may include group activities, indoor or outdoor activities, exercise and other creative and expressive therapies.

* Conducts group educational/recreational activity sessions.
* Maintain appropriate documentation including progress notes of type of activity and client.

* Develops and updates activity schedules as needed.
* Maintains safe recreation or therapy supplies and is responsible for safety security of these supplies.

**Qualifications**

* Degree or Registration/Certification in related educational or therapeutic fields. Minimum of two years experience in working with persons suffering from mental illness and/or substance abuse preferred.
* Basic knowledge of referrals, both in and out of the program.
* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Possess valid drivers license.
* CPR/First Aid certification required, obtained upon employment and maintained current thereafter.
* Criminal background clearance required.
* Health screen, proof of MMR vaccination or antibodies, negative TB test results.

title: Cashier/Counter Service at ROWSEELEE
description:
**About ROWSEELEE:** ROWSEELEE represents a revolutionary F&B concept that seamlessly merges the worlds of Food & Beverage, Fashion, and Technology. Our establishment is dedicated to offering an unparalleled culinary experience, where innovation and creativity converge to create unforgettable moments for our customers. As we embark on this exciting journey, we are seeking a dynamic individual to join our team as a Cashier & Brand Spokesperson. This role is not just about processing transactions; it's about embodying our brand ethos and creating meaningful connections with our patrons.

**Position Overview:** As a Cashier & Brand Spokesperson at ROWSEELEE, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the customer experience at our establishment. Beyond handling front-of-house responsibilities such as cashier duties, you will serve as the face of our brand, engaging with customers to share our compelling story and showcase our unique product offerings. This position requires a passion for customer interaction, a flair for storytelling, and a dedication to providing exceptional service.

**Responsibilities:**

* Greet customers warmly and provide attentive service throughout their visit.
* Operate the cashier station efficiently, processing transactions accurately and in a timely manner.
* Act as a brand ambassador, sharing the ROWSEELEE story and highlighting our distinctive ingredients and product offerings.
* Assist customers in signing up for our loyalty program and provide information about current promotions and special events.
* Engage with customers on social media platforms, generating content and supporting promotional activities to enhance brand visibility.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to develop creative strategies for engaging with our target audience and driving customer engagement.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the front-of-house area, ensuring a welcoming environment for our guests.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in customer service, hospitality, or retail is preferred.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to engage and connect with customers of diverse backgrounds.
* Enthusiasm for learning about our brand, product offerings, and the intersection of F&B, Fashion, and Technology.
* Strong multitasking abilities and attention to detail, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Familiarity with social media platforms and a willingness to contribute to our online presence.
* A positive attitude and a passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage
* Opportunities for growth and advancement within a dynamic and innovative organization
* Employee discounts on ROWSEELEE products and services
* A supportive and collaborative work environment that encourages creativity and personal development

If you are a motivated and outgoing individual with a passion for storytelling and brand representation, we invite you to apply for the Cashier & Brand Spokesperson position at ROWSEELEE. Join us in redefining the future of the F&B industry and creating memorable experiences for our customers. Apply today and become a part of our exciting journey!

title: Office Administrator
description:
Office Administrator

Office Administrator (OA) position manages the day-to-day office operations of a non-profit organization whose work focuses on education, advocacy, community services and philanthropy; primarily advocating for justice, public policy and community support for women, children and families

This position requires a top-notch administrator who can work independently, is self-motivated and is confident in their capabilities. The OA is responsible for the organization’s daily office operations, income management, creative communication materials and support of all meetings and events.

Qualifications:

Two years min. experience with non-profit office management and/or administration preferred.

Excellent communication and people-skills a must.

Solid technology skills required. Creative abilities a plus.

Must be able to work independently and be responsive to supervision.

Must be self-motivated, show initiative, be organized and able to multi-task.

The OA is responsible to:

· Work closely with the Co-Presidents and Executive Board.

· Answer office telephone, emails, and texts. Check messages daily and respond to requests for information and refer to the appropriate NCJW representative/member.

· Prepare for the Board and Executive Meetings materials and follow-up as requested.

· Learn and manage the membership, events, donation Giftworks database. Enter information of all donors, for all fundraisers, trips, events and donations. Work with event chairs to share relevant the information.

· Manage daily income, deposits and communication with the Treasurer.

· Manage the membership lists, dues income and support the membership committee by sending member information and follow-up.

· Prepare annual board list and directory and annual board packets.

· Create / design the monthly Council newsletter and collaboration with the editor.

· Manage communication with community partners, legislators, other local Sections and the National organization.

· Manage the office, supplies, equipment and forecast office needs.

· Work with the communications department, web master, data base and credit card companies to maintain effective web-based operations that offer online access for information and to make donations.

· Post Social media material, create E-blasts / flyers as requested by VP and chairs and/or communications dept.

Experience working with children is required, and additional training may also be required.

Seven Acres Montessori is an independent school, offering AMI Montessori education in Fairfield County, Connecticut since 1964. We are a family-oriented community deeply rooted in Montessori philosophy and practice and committed to Dr. Montessori’s vision of educating the whole child. We serve children from 14 months or “walking”, (Toddler) through 14 years (completion of 8th grade).

The Seven Acres Montessori community is inclusive and built on the tenets of collaborative relationships and respect. We believe in sharing what we have with those in need and encouraging children to learn to live responsibly. We welcome dedicated, fun loving, individuals to bring their talents and skills to our children and families. Located in Lower Fairfield Country, we offer a competitive salary package. We are committed to creating a diverse environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Interested candidates are encouraged to send a cover letter and resume to Careers@sevenacresmontessori.org; and please specify the age (of students) that you are most interested/qualified to work with.

description:
