If you are passionate about improving the lives of children on the spectrum and want to work for a company that prioritizes integrity, creativity, and compassion, please keep reading. We provide full training for those just starting their careers in the ABA (Applied Behavior Analysis) field and room for growth for more experienced candidates.

**Here's what we offer:**

* **Competitive Pay: Starting at $20/ hr**
* **A Rewarding Career:** Helping kids achieve their goals!
* **Additional Income:** Bonuses, raises, and incentives.
* **Training**: Ongoing training and support
* **Culture**: Innovative, Creative, and Ethical
* **Growth:** RBT Certification and aspiring BCBA program

**Here's what we need from you:**

* **Education**: High School Diploma or College Degree
* **Experience**: Childcare, healthcare, or mental health preferred (but we will train the right candidate)
* **Dependability**: Consistency and reliability is crucial for the child's success
* **Integrity**: You will work in the child's home without constant supervision
* **Positivity & Patience:** It's all about positive reinforcement and repetition
* **Communication**: Excellent written and verbal communication in English

**Behavior Therapist Job Responsibilities:**

* Provide one on one in-home Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy
* Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions
* Conduct Discrete Trials, Natural Environment Teaching, and various teaching/reinforcement methods in line with the Behavior Support Plan.
* Work collaboratively with a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA therapy.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Strong technology skills for data collection and entry
* Professional written and oral communication skills
* Ability to maintain a positive attitude while being an active participant who contributes to team activities, meetings, and training
* Ability to set and achieve goals that benefit the patient, the team, and the BT/RBT
* Ability to receive feedback, coaching, and counseling while maintaining a positive attitude and commitment to be a continuous learner
* Ability to pass a background screen, reference checks, and drug screen

**Physical Working Conditions:**

* Ability to bend, kneel, crouch, and spend time standing as well as an ability to lift items up to 50 lbs
* Endurance to move quickly from a seated position to a standing position to accommodate the treatment plan and/ or for the safety of the patient
* Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity enough to operate office equipment, etc.

At Cultivate we celebrate and support diversity. We thrive off our differences to provide the highest quality practices for our communities. Cultivate is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants. Our policies and practices prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $27.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have ABA experience?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Stamford, CT: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Ring Sales-Promotion Specialist
description:
Balfour & Co. is currently searching for outgoing, attentive Promotion Specialists (Sales Associates) to help during class ring sales events across the United States.

We are currently looking for candidates in the **New York, NY**  area.

Candidates must have reliable transportation and be willing to travel in and around New York City (Mileage reimbursement is provided).

Promotion Specialists are paid $20 per hour, plus commissions with events lasting anywhere from 4 – 10 hours. Mileage reimbursement is also provided at $0.67 per mile. This is a seasonal, part-time, event-based job. The season is typically February – May and August – December each year.

We are looking for people who are interested in traveling around to the different schools in their area and working with us long-term, season after season. The position is not for the faint-hearted! We are looking for outgoing, efficient people with strong personalities, sales experience, and customer service attitudes.

The main responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Informing groups of students about Balfour & Co. and the products and services provided
* Assisting customers with on-site iPad sales
* Setting up, Organizing, and breaking down event displays

The main requirements include but are not limited to:

* Ability to operate tech devices (iPad), and to assist and direct customers on how to use them.
* Comfortable working with and speaking with large groups of people
* Ability to stand and move about for the duration of the event, whether indoor or outdoor
* Ability to lift to 30 lbs.
* Ability to always present themselves maturely and professionally
* Ability to adhere to a schedule, arrive on time for work, and stay until the event is over. If you are scheduled for an event and confirm your attendance, you are expected to work at the event.
* Ability to adhere to the dress code. Business casual attire is required: employees should present and maintain a professional personal appearance and consider neatness and cleanliness. A neutral-colored mask is required and must be worn unless otherwise stated.
* Authorized to work in the U.S. for any employer without sponsorship.

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Balfour & Co. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Are you able to adhere to the dress code? Business casual attire is required
* Are you able to operate tech devices (iPad)?
* Do you have at least one year of customer service experience?

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Performance Reporting Analyst
description:
**Investment Analyst**

**Company Overview:** Join our forward-thinking RIA team at Essex Wealth Management, a financial services practice dedicated to providing tailored investment solutions to our family of clients. With a focus on innovation and high touch service, we pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and integrity. As we continue to grow and expand our offerings, we are seeking a skilled and motivated Investment Analyst to join our dynamic team.

**Position Overview:** As an Investment Analyst at Essex Wealth Management, you will play a crucial role in supporting our investment strategies and providing valuable insights to our clients. Leveraging our expertise in sales, asset management, planning, and insurance, you will contribute to the development and implementation of strategies that align with our clients' goals and objectives. This hybrid position- 3 days in the office, is an exciting opportunity for a talented professional looking to make a significant impact in the financial services industry.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct thorough research and analysis on various investment opportunities, including stocks, bonds, managed funds, private and alternative investments.
* Assist in the development of investment strategies and portfolio management techniques based on client needs and market conditions.
* Collaborate with financial advisors and clients to understand their investment goals and risk tolerance.
* Prepare detailed investment proposals and presentations for client meetings.
* Monitor and evaluate portfolio performance, making recommendations for adjustments as needed.
* Stay informed about market trends, economic indicators, and regulatory changes that may impact investment decisions.
* Provide exceptional customer service and build strong relationships with clients to ensure their long-term satisfaction.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Previous experience 3-7 yrs in sales, investments, financial planning, or insurance preferred.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret financial data and market trends.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and effectively.
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and precision.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Professional certifications such as CFA, CFP, or Series 7 are a plus.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and bonus structure.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including life and health insurance, 401K,etc.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.
* A supportive and inclusive work environment that values commitment to excellence and teamwork.

**How to Apply:** If you are a motivated and analytical thinker with a passion for investments and a background in sales, planning, or insurance, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and relevant experience to jjarmel@essexwmg.com. Be sure to include "Investment Analyst Application" in the subject line. We look forward to reviewing your application!

Essex Wealth Management is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes individuals of all backgrounds to apply.

title: Ultrasound Tech
description:
Job Title: Ultrasound Technologist

Location: Queens, NY

Blended Rate: $3200/wk

Shift: 5x8s- 40hrs - Evenings/Nights available

We are seeking an experienced and skilled Ultrasound Technologist to join our prestigious medical facility in Queens, NY. As an Ultrasound Technologist, you will play a crucial role in the diagnostic process by performing high-quality ultrasound examinations on patients, producing accurate and detailed images, and providing exceptional patient care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform diagnostic ultrasound examinations using medical equipment to visualize internal organs, tissues, and vessels.
* Capture and analyze appropriate diagnostic images and data for interpretation by physicians.
* Ensure accurate image labeling, data entry, and patient records maintenance.
* Collaborate with physicians to provide preliminary findings and assist in the formulation of patient treatment plans.
* Ensure equipment is well-maintained, cleaned, and stocked with necessary supplies.
* Adhere to safety protocols, infection control guidelines, and regulatory standards to ensure patient safety and quality of care.
* Communicate effectively with patients, explaining procedures and ensuring their comfort throughout the examination process.
* Maintain a high level of professionalism and compassion when dealing with patients, colleagues, and other healthcare professionals.
* Keep abreast of industry advancements, new techniques, and equipment to enhance personal knowledge and improve patient care.

**Requirements:**

* Proven working experience as an Ultrasound Technologist.
* Possess a degree in Medical Sonography or a related field.
* Certification in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS, ARRT, or equivalent).
* Proficiency in operating and troubleshooting ultrasound equipment.
* Solid understanding of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment.
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
* Must be able to work flexible schedules, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

We offer a competitive salary of $3200 weekly, along with a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, retirement plans, and paid time off. Join our dynamic team and contribute to the delivery of excellent patient care at our esteemed medical facility in Queens, NY.

**Working for Seven Healthcare:**

Seven Healthcare is one of the USA's most popular agencies for Ultrasound Technologist jobs. Rated ‘Excellent’ on Trustpilot from 1900+ reviews, and with 20 major awards behind us, we take pride in knowing we can find you the best possible rates in a role you can be proud of.

title: Business Systems Analyst, NetSuite & Finance
description:
Our mission at Oura is to empower every person to own their inner potential. Our award-winning products help our global community gain a deeper knowledge of their readiness, activity, and sleep quality by using their Oura Ring and its connected app. We've helped 2.5 million people understand and improve their health by providing daily insights and practical steps to inspire healthy lifestyles.
  
  

Empowering the world starts with living our values and empowering our team. As a quickly growing company focused on helping people live healthier and happier lives, we ensure that our team members have what they need to do their best work — both in and out of the office.
  
  

We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst, NetSuite/Finance to join our Business Technology team. This is a hands-on techno-functional position that requires a strong understanding of general accounting principles and practices and how they operate within NetSuite. In addition to core accounting expertise, you will be responsible for partnering with the finance team to create solutions to everyday business problems. To be successful in this role, the candidate should have experience with core NetSuite process flows and modules, NetSuite customisation and reporting functionality.
  
  

**What you will do:**  

Assist finance users with requests and problems in the ERP system
  
Build reports and searches to meet finance team requirements
  
Basic NetSuite ERP configuration (adding new fields, forms, custom records, etc.)
  
Partner with the Finance team and the Business Technology team to build solutions to business problems
  
Coordinate projects with the Finance team and development resources
  
Assist Finance team in streamlining work streams in the ERP
  
Work to improve automation of existing manual processes for Finance users
  
  

This is a remote US role with a slight preference for candidates based in MST, CST, or EST.
  
  

Requirements
  
  

**We would love to have you on our team if you have:**  

2+ years NetSuite experience
  
2+ years accounting experience/education
  
Strong functional knowledge of core accounting processes as they relate to NetSuite ERP
  
Working knowledge of GAAP accounting principles and experience operationalizing them
  
Experience working with OneWorld/multi-subsidiary multinational organizations operating on NetSuite
  
Good communication skills
  
Solid time management/project management skills
  
Benefits
  
  

At Oura, we care about you and your well-being. Everyone here at Oura has a ring of their own and we are continually looking to improve employee health and add to our benefits!
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Competitive salary and equity packages
  
Health, dental, vision insurance, and mental health resources
  
An Oura Ring of your own plus employee discounts for friends & family
  
20 days of paid time off plus 13 paid holidays plus 8 days of flexible wellness time off
  
Paid sick leave and parental leave
  
Amazing culture of collaborative and passionate coworkers
  
  

Oura takes a market-based approach to pay, which may vary depending on your location. US locations are categorized into tiers based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. While most offers will be closer to the starting range, successful candidates' pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, internal peer equity, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.
  
  

**Region 1:** $115,000.00 - $128,000.00
  
**Region 2:** $109,000.00 - $122,000.00
  
**Region 3:** $103,000.00 - $115,000.00
  
  

A recruiter can determine your zones/tiers based on your US location.
  
  

**To all recruitment agencies:** Oura does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Oura employees, or any other organization's location. Oura is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
  
  

Oura is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Individuals seeking employment at Oura are considered without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.
  
  

We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

title: Medical Office Assistant
description:
**MEDICAL OFFICE ASSISTANT QUALIFICATIONS:**

 Requires a HS diploma and is a graduate of an accredited Medical Assistant program.

 Experience in an ambulatory care setting is preferred.  Basic computer skills required.

 BLS certified.

 Fluency in English, oral and written form, is required.

 Bi-lingual in Spanish preferred.

**MEDICAL OFFICE ASSISTANT POSITION SUMMARY:**

 Works under the direct supervision of the nursing and medical provider staff while assisting and performing a prescribed set of duties in the provision of patient care.

 Assumes additional responsibilities for all clerical functions in the assigned clinic, as applicable, and when assigned.

 Is able to articulate and demonstrate compliance to all DFCC policies/procedures that are applicable to this position.  Supports the mission and philosophy of Damian Family Care Centers, Inc.

**MEDICAL OFFICE ASSISTANT ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

 Demonstrates initiative, competency and enthusiasm for carrying out daily assignments; assisting and taking direction from DFCCs health care providers in the delivery of patient care and maintaining patient flow; demonstrates the ability to function as part of an interdisciplinary health care team.

 Accurately performs & records vital assessments in every medical visit to include but, not limited to: vital signs, weight, height and promptly reports abnormalities to the medical provider or designated nursing staff on duty.

 Acts as scribe and enters History and Physical information, chief complaint, medications, allergies and family history into a chart or Electronic Medical Record and assisting patient in filling out self-report questionnaire.

 Provides prepared family and patient education materials. Refers to RN/Provider on duty in the event of any additional questions from the patient.

 Assists an authorized practitioner, under the direct and personal supervision of said practitioner, to carry out a specific task that does not require medical judgement or decision making.

 Collects and documents Depression Screening and Tobacco Screening questionnaire responses from patients and alert the provider if any of the questionnaire renders positive response for further action.

 Acts as scribe and utilizes appropriate techniques and complies with written standards when performing waived testing and quality control procedures. Promptly records and reports results to medical provider or designated nursing staff on duty in accordance with agency procedure.

 Utilizes appropriate technique in performing venipuncture to obtain blood specimens in accordance with agency procedure; verbalizes knowledge of and adheres to OSHA standards for blood-borne pathogens when handling blood and body fluids; maintains universal precautions in the provision of patient care.

 Demonstrates compliance to infection control protocols and maintains a safe, clean and therapeutic work environment. Utilizes aseptic technique in the sterilization of instruments utilized for Dental and Specialty services as assigned.

 Conduct appointment reminder calls one or two days prior the scheduled appointment.

 Makes no show outreach calls for all patients and document in chart as per no show protocol.

 Adheres to all the front desk registration and workflow guidelines for new and established patients. i.e. validate patients demographic information every visit, collect and document PCP information appropriately, collect patients email address and provide access to portal.

 Assist with connecting patients to outside practices for specialty services as instructed by provider on duty.

 Demonstrates initiative and competency in the utilization of Health Information Technology to perform essential job functions, which includes but, is not limited to (1) documentation in the eCW/EHR, (2) Transmission of ePHI, (3) Retrieval of ePHI (4) Visit summary reports (5) Scanning of PHI

 Maintains and monitors stock inventory in the treatment center and replenishes supplies in exam rooms on a timely basis. Prepares and processes requisitions for routine supplies in accordance with agency procedures.

 Monitors the integrity of equipment and promptly reports malfunction, missing or damaged equipment to the Regional Nurse Manager in accordance with agency procedure.

 Maintains a work environment that fosters collaboration and communication between all health care team members, projects a positive image to the communities we serve and demonstrates respect for the cultural and religious diversities and needs of patients, families and care providers.

 Conforms to policies and regulations governing patient rights, confidentiality, and HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules.

 Maintains an efficient system for scheduling appointments for patients in accordance with established agency procedures, when assigned.

 Facilitates communication with appropriate staff in the Therapeutic communities regarding missed appointments and abnormal test results in accordance with agency procedure, as applicable to clinic location and patient population serviced and assignment.

 Retrieves medical records on a timely basis and in accordance with established procedures for: (a) scheduled patient visits (b) transport to other clinics of DFCC, Inc. (c) correspondence (d) photocopying as applicable and assignment.

 Organizes and maintains an efficient system for verifying location of charts and filing active medical records at the clinic site by unit record number as applicable and assigned.

 Promptly forwards discharge charts to DFCC for archiving, in accordance with agency procedures, as applicable and assigned.

 Demonstrates respect for the cultural and religious diversities and needs of patients, families, care providers and external customers.

 Creates an atmosphere of courtesy and respect towards patients, families, and staff.

 Maintains a consistent and flexible pattern of attendance in accordance with assigned schedule and reports to work on time.

 Demonstrates a commitment to the position by attending in-service programs.

 Conforms to agency guidelines regarding dress code; is well groomed and neat; demonstrates good personal hygiene.

 Is able to meet physical requirements of position to include lifting up to 20 lbs. and standing for long periods of time.

 Performs all related duties as assigned or unrelated duties, as requested.

title: Maintenance Planner
description:
Global Planner  
As a Global Planner, you will play a critical role in strategic resource allocation, optimization and capacity planning within our organization.

You will be responsible for developing and implementing global planning strategies to optimize the utilization of resources, meet customer demand, and support the achievement  
of business objectives. Your expertise in supply chain management, demand forecasting, and capacity planning will be essential in coordinating and aligning planning activities across multiple locations and  
timeframes.  
Global Planners will be assigned by product segment and be responsible for identification and clear  
articulation of global demand, supply, capacity and inventory requirements, constraints, mitigation &  
optimization plans defined and confirmed through the S&OP process.  
Responsibilities:  
● Develop and execute global planning strategies by product, considering factors such as customer  
demand, production capacity, inventory levels, lead times.  
● Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, operations, procurement, and logistics,  
to gather demand forecasts, production plans, and inventory data to support the global planning  
process.  
● Conduct analysis and evaluation of demand patterns, market trends, and supply chain constraints  
to ensure accurate and robust global planning.  
● Define and maintain global planning parameters, such as safety stock levels, reorder points, and  
lead times, based on business requirements and optimization models.  
● Coordinate with ALAM affiliates, Finite Planners and other stakeholders to align inventory,  
capacity and resource utilization across different locations, ensuring optimal production and  
distribution strategies.  
● Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs), such as forecast accuracy, inventory  
turns, service levels, and production efficiency, to identify areas for improvement and develop  
action plans.  
● Collaborate with technology teams to leverage planning systems and tools, ensuring their  
effective utilization and driving continuous improvement initiatives.  
● Drive supply chain visibility and transparency through regular reporting and communication of  
global planning metrics, forecasts, and performance updates to key stakeholders through the  
S&OP process.  
● Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in global planning  
and supply chain management, incorporating relevant insights into the planning processes.  
● Participate in cross-functional projects and initiatives to enhance operational efficiency, mitigate  
risks, and support strategic objectives.  
● Maintain close coordination with sales, products, customer service and AL affiliates to ensure reliability of supply.  
● Drive adherence to and refinement of the S&OP process & performance especially in the areas of demand, supply, capacity, inventory.  
● Drive accountability through process performance metrics and continuous improvement initiatives.  
● Identify, initiate & lead continuous improvement initiatives improving supply chain effectiveness across multiple sites & the global supply chain.  
● Lead supply chain taskforce coordinating all activity internal and external to facilitate required supply to customers.  
● Facilitate and act as single point of contact for affiliate communications during supply chain taskforce  
● Act as a formal mentor to Finite or Global planning team members

Writing of SOP’s, SWI’s, scheduling guidelines and competencies for S&OP and other planning  
related actions.  
● Drive and replicate supply chain operational excellence and best practices across multiple sites.

Required Qualifications:  
● Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, operations management, or a related field.  
Master's degree is a plus.  
● 7-10+ yrs proven experience in global planning, supply chain management, or related roles within a complex manufacturing or distribution environment.  
● Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret and analyze large datasets and make data-driven decisions.  
● Proficient in using planning software and tools, such as ERP systems, demand planning software, and capacity modeling tools.  
● Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at various organizational levels.  
● Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.  
● Knowledge of lean and continuous improvement principles, with experience in driving process optimization and efficiency gains. (Green or Black Belt certification)  
● Familiarity with global trade regulations, logistics, and inventory management practices.  
(w/certifications)  
● Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic environment, demonstrating resilience and flexibility.  
● APICS certification strongly encouraged & desired

title: Per Diem RN Nurse Supervisor
description:
**Job Summary**

**Nurse Supervisor - Per Diem**

Schervier Nursing Care Center is 364 bed skilled nursing facility providing both long and short term care. We are currently searching for Per- Diem RN Supervisors for all shifts. In this essential position, you’ll be responsible for the off-shift clinical operations and management of our Nursing Department team. In collaboration with, you’ll work on providing our patients with safe, quality treatment while also determining the right short and long term goals for patients on a case by case basis. You’ll also focus your efforts on monitoring compliance to ensure the best care is given to each and every individual.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Assure that effective quality nursing care is delivered which is outcome focused through utilization of the nursing process. Identify needs and provide input for discharge planning and follow-up throughout length of stay.
* Be point person for admissions during off hours, including providing tours, welcoming new families and residents, ensuring a smooth and comfortable admission experience.
* Implement plan of care consistently, effectively and cost efficiently with focus on resident centered outcomes.
* Work in collaboration with physicians and/or other health care professionals by sharing information relevant to changing plan of care.
* Supervise and coordinate RN, LPN and CNA assignments and activities in an assigned unit and shift accordingly. Will ensure timely communication of current treatment & assessment information, efficient delivery of services and timely compilation of new information.
* Monitor and evaluate staff activities to ensure that nursing care is carried out as directed, and treatment administered in accordance with treatment plans and physicians’ instructions.
* Ensure reference materials are current and assist the nursing service department in meeting the needs of the residents
* Admit, transfer and discharge residents as required
* Ensure that staffing levels are appropriate
* Round daily with the nursing services departments to address issues and confirm that work assignments are completed in accordance with facility standards
* Provide information to residents & staff by answering questions and requests.
* Maintain safe & clean working environment by implementing rules & regulations
* Maintain resident confidence by monitoring confidential information processing.
* Maintain documentation of resident care services.
* Maintain a positive/cooperative working relationship among staff

**Qualifications and Skills**

**Requirements :**

Valid NY Registered Nurse (RN) license. Minimum 2 years Long-Term Care experience required. Should be familiar with EHR and E-prescribing programs. Excellent communication skills. Basic computer skills.

Pay: $43.46 - $47.08 per hour

title: Technology Director
description:
Strata Alliance is composed of multiple professional service firms including Campolo, Middleton & McCormick (CMM). We are looking for a technology leader to oversee all aspects of our technology operations, including hardware, software, cloud services, helpdesk, and other related systems. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Managed Service Provider (MSP) and report to the Vice President of Operations. Your main responsibility will be to implement and support technology that aligns with the firm’s vision, while maximizing efficiency and success across all business units. Key duties will involve strategic planning for current and future technology initiatives, aligning business objectives with technology solutions, and managing helpdesk and support operations.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate effective leadership and management in technology operations, with extensive hands-on experience across various technology systems. This depth of knowledge will enable the candidate to provide expert support for both existing and future Information technology environments.

***Responsibilities:***  
**Strategy & Planning**

* Ensure IT strategy and objectives align with and drive the business’s success.
* Implement IT initiatives and manage systems that support the firm’s operations and objectives.
* Work with business units to create and maintain a technology plan that meets organizational needs.
* Facilitate stakeholder consultations to define business objectives and system requirements for new technology implementations.
* Manage and prioritize projects related to the selection, acquisition, development, and installation of information systems.
* Develop and manage IT budget, including the IT financial strategy, TCO, procurement and vendor management.
* Manage internal IT staff member/s, fostering collaboration for cross departmental platforms, in addition to developing technical documentation and offering guidance or related training.

**Technology Management & Operations**

* Implement and ensure continuous delivery of IT services through service level agreements and monitoring of IT systems performance including but not limited to:
* **Network and Communication Services**: Installation and ongoing management of Strata Alliance’s network (e.g., LAN, WAN), telephony, internet, and telecommunications equipment (e.g., routers, firewalls, switches, phone hardware, MFA, SSO, etc.)
* **IT Operations and Hosting**: Implementing, provisioning, and ongoing management of Strata Alliance’s server(s), storage solutions, database(s), third-party applications, internal support SharePoint (or related), business continuity plans, and disaster recovery services, Internet Services providers.
* **End User Services**: Implementing, and managing Strata Alliance’s asset lifecycle (e.g., procurement, asset management, installation, recovery, deployment, disposal) for PCs, mobile device, print, Help Desk, deskside support, messaging and collaboration management tools / services, performance monitoring, OS Patches and endpoint security.
* **Audiovisual / Security**: Provide support for boardroom, conference rooms, projectors, TVs, and interactive solutions for staff and in-house events. Manage and maintain security cameras, access control systems, low voltage cabling, including organization of vendor support of such technologies. Coordinate future enhancements and upgrades to Audio Visual and Security systems.

**Skills & Experience**

* Strong customer service, multitasking and prioritization skills.
* Highly skilled in project management, presentations, and documentation.
* Professionalism and high ethical standards
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Hands on Experience with Microsoft Platforms including Windows, Server, Hypervisor, Active Directory, Office 365, SharePoint, Azure.
* Foundational knowledge and hands-on experience with the management of firewalls, network equipment, virtual servers, Backups, storage and cloud platforms; Sophos and Datto experience preferred.

**Qualifications**

* At least 10 years’ experience with small or medium sized organizations, preferably with experience working in law firms, accounting firms or related industry experience.
* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, information systems, related field or comparable experience.
* Technical Certifications desired:
* CompTIA Network+
* CompTIA Security+
* Microsoft 365 Certified Administrator
* Related Microsoft Server, Hybrid, or Azure Certifications

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance

Schedule:

title: RN Care Coordinator
description:
Hours: 4, 10 Hour Variable Weekdays, with rotating weekends. Days are 8:00am to 6:00pm and Weekends are 8:0am to 6:00pm

Are you a highly skilled and compassionate RN looking for a rewarding career as a recovery care coordinator? If so, we invite you to join the team at Mt. Sinai, in partnership with Contessa, an Amedisys company. Amedisys is one of the largest and most trusted home health and hospice companies in the U.S.

**Attractive pay**

* $50.00-$57.00
* 15,000 K Bonus

**Enjoy great perks and benefits**

* A full benefits package with choice of affordable PPO or HSA medical plans.
* Paid time off.
* Up to $1,300 in free healthcare services paid by Amedisys yearly, when enrolled in an Amedisys HSA medical plan.
* Up to $500 in wellness rewards for completing activities during the year. Use these rewards to support your wellbeing with spa/massage/salon services, gym memberships, fitness classes, sports, hobbies, pets and more. \\*
* Mental health support, including up to five free counseling sessions per year through the Amedisys Employee Assistance program.
* 401(k) with a company match.
* Family support with infertility treatment coverage\\*, adoption reimbursement, paid parental and family caregiver leave.
* Fleet vehicle program\\*\\* and mileage reimbursement.
* And more.

*Please note: Benefit eligibility can vary by position depending on shift status.*

*\\*To participate, you must be enrolled in an Amedisys medical plan.*

*\\*\\*For full-time caregivers meeting certain requirements.*

**What's in it for you**

* Community-based care centers with a supportive and inclusive work environment.
* Better work/life balance and increased flexibility compared to other settings.
* Job stability and the opportunity to advance with a growing company.
* The opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of patients and their families providing much needed care where they want to be - in their homes.

**Don't just take it from us - see what our caregivers love about Amedisys**

*"I have worked here just shy of a year and it's the best job I've ever had! We have an awesome team and administration is very supportive. I never felt so appreciated. Your time off is really yours."* - Amedisys caregiver

**Why Amedisys**  
Amedisys is a leading provider of home health, hospice and high-acuity care, dedicated to helping patients and families navigate the complex healthcare system. With a focus on compassionate, patient-centered care, you would be joining a team of professionals committed to improving the lives of those they serve.

Responsibilities:

* Works directly with the patient and their providers for a full 30 days to allow patients to receive acute care in the comfort of their own homes, in lieu of an inpatient setting.
* Possesses clinical knowledge and experience to identify, present and discuss potential patients to providers for program inclusion. These direct discussions usually include ED providers and hospitalists, but may span across multiple subspecialties.
* Facilitates communication and coordination between all members of the care team to coordinate admissions.
* Coordinates referrals and appropriate resources to assist patient and/or caregiver in continuation of care in the outpatient setting.
* Maintains all required documentation in all interactions with our health systems' patients and care team.
* Interacts with the patient and the multidisciplinary team to coordinate the services ordered by our partners' physicians.
* Communicates to the appropriate providers about any barriers to the patients' fulfillment of our partner provider's care plan.
* Communicates discharge information to other clinical departments or members of the care team.
* Ensures that patients have access to appropriate services to meet their provider-directed care plan needs.
* Monitors the care that the patient receives and brings it to the attention of a provider.
* Performs all other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

* Associate of Science in nursing.
* Current RN license, specific to the state you are assigned to work.
* Two years of RN experience.
* Ability to work on call, day and evening shifts and rotating holidays.

Preferred:

* Bachelor of Science in nursing.
* ED and ICU experience.
* Care Coordination and Transition Management (C.C.C.T.M) certification.

title: French Instructor for kids grades: prek-k September and on (Mondays)
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $50 per class. It's about a 1 hour commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contractor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occasionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for French Immersion** 

Parlez-vous français? Would you like to learn French? Grammar and conjugation rules will be taught but we do not use the “by heart” method, we favor the intuitive aspect of learning through original activities. You'll learn typical French expressions, pronunciation and French culture too. Lessons are presented in an interactive, colorful way- full of games, riddles, jokes, and animations to help time fly by!

This class does not come with a curriculum and you must develop your own..

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $60 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

Class Specifics

Neighborhood: Upper East side (E.70's)

Dates: 9/23/24 - 12/9/24 (Mondays)

Time: 2:45pm -3:25pm

Grades: Prek-k

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

As of right now we are actively hiring for: Cartoon animation and comics creation, piano, chess, soccer, programmable robots, French Immersion, LEGO, Spanish Immersion, Digital Photography, Healthy Kids Club, Music Kids, Pokemon Arts Academy, Group Piano, and Hip Hop dancing.

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Required)
* Experience with children: 1 year (Required)
* Classroom management: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: General Dentist
description:
Oakwood Dental is a well-established and patient-centric dental clinic committed to providing exceptional oral healthcare. We pride ourselves on delivering a positive patient experience through a combination of expertise, compassion, and cutting-edge technology. As we continue to grow, we are seeking multiple dedicated General Dentists to join our dynamic team in Staten Island and New Jersey. We are conveniently located, with multiple locations, which will offer the opportunity for a smooth commute. We are also open to considering graduate dentists for this position.

**General Dentist**

We are looking for a General Dentist with a minimum of 1 years experience to contribute to the success and growth of our practice. The ideal candidate will be passionate about delivering high-quality dental care, building patient relationships, and collaborating with our team of professionals.

**Salary:**

Pay: $150,000.00 - $400,000.00 per year

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Clinical**

1. Examine and diagnose patients' teeth and surrounding oral structures, employing X-rays, mouth mirrors, exploratory tools, and diagnostic procedures. Record findings, formulate and execute the most suitable treatment plan, including cosmetic dentistry procedures.

2. Offers guidance on preventive dentistry, assesses nutritional status, evaluates oral hygiene practices, and provides expertise in cosmetic dentistry to enhance patients' smiles and self-confidence.

3. Identifies and addresses cavities in teeth, while also offering cosmetic solutions for aesthetic enhancements.

4. Performs extractions of impacted, infected, or problematic teeth, as well as root canal procedures, with a focus on preserving the appearance and functionality of the patient's smile.

5. Provides dental health advice to patients and collaborates with dental hygienists, dental assistants, or dental laboratory technicians as needed to complete procedures, including cosmetic dental treatments.

6. Collaborates with heads of other patient care services to plan comprehensive dental treatment, ensuring seamless coordination of patient care, including cosmetic dentistry services to achieve patients' desired outcomes.

**Learning and Documentation**

* Stay updated on patient care, new technology and new products that can improve patient conditions and overall health.
* Keep comprehensive and accurate records of patient visits, diagnosis and treatment.
* Keep certifications, registrations and CPD in accordance with national laws and regulations.
* Increase client base by building relationships with existing and new patients. We welcome all suggestions and ideas to help the growth of our practices.

**Qualifications:**

-DDS (Doctor of Dental Surgery) or DMD (Doctor of Dental Medicine) degree from an ADA accredited dental school, and a Bachelor’s degree are required

- Minimum of 1 year of clinical experience as a General Dentist

- State licensure and relevant certifications

- Proficient in performing routine and complex dental procedures

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

- Commitment to patient satisfaction and quality care

-Up-to-date knowledge of dental standards and guidelines, public health standards, and dental medicine trends and advances is desired

-Unrestricted and current state license in good standing

**Benefits:**

-401(k)

-Health insurance

-Paid time off

**Schedule:**

-Monday to Friday

-Weekends as needed

**How to Apply:**

If you are a skilled General Dentist with a passion for patient care and a commitment to excellence, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you are a great fit and get in contact with the team at our offices in Staten Island. Oakwood Dental is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply.

Pay: $150,000.00 - $400,000.00 per year

title: Assistant Program Supervisor Fort Lee NJ
description:
Assistant Program Supervisor needed for a Residential group home located in Fort Lee, NJ. This position reports directly to the Program Supervisor. This is a forty-hour per week position. This position shift if 4 weekdays from 3pm-11pm and Saturday 3pm-11pm. You will be required to oversee the daily operational oversight of a residential program servicing individuals with autism and other related developmental disabilities. You will also be responsible for providing direct oversight to the direct care professionals. . Must have three years of Program Assistant Supervisorial experience within a residential program supporting individuals with autism and other intellectual disabilities. Bring to work your empathy, compassion, good judgment and reliability and you will succeed.

Examples of Responsibilities:

* To ensure the safety and well-being of each service recipient under the guidance of Fordham-Lewis, Consulting, LLC.
* To participate in the development and implementation of skill acquisition programs for each service recipient under the guidance of Fordham-Lewis, Consulting, LLC.
* To participate in the development of Individual Service goals and objectives for each service recipient under the guidance of Fordham-Lewis, Consulting, LLC.
* The Assistant Program Supervisor will be responsible for identifying service recipients needs disaggregating and analyzing data and recommending outcomes for the programs.
* The Assistant Program Supervisor will assist the Program Supervisor to be responsible for program design and development. The Assistant Program Supervisor and the Program Supervisor will disseminate instructional strategies and provide staff assistance in the implementation of effective assessment techniques.
* The Assistant Program Supervisor will be responsible for assisting the Program Supervisor in the supervision and evaluation of staff and maintain appropriate records to support findings.
* The Assistant Program Supervisor, along with the Program Supervisor will develop and implement performance objectives as related to the stakeholders at Fordham-Lewis, Consulting, LLC.
* The Assistant Program Supervisor will work with the Program Supervisor to be responsible for the development of positive attitudes relative to the agencies business.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.75 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Social Services Administrators: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person
company_description: Fordinam-Lewis, a trusted place where we develop an individualized plan to help people with autism and other intellectual disabilities to carry on their journey as an active member of our community.

title: Customer Service Associate - Store #8487
description:
**Job Description**  
**Job Title:** Customer Service Associate  
**Location:** Field  
**Department:** Store Operations  
**Job Summary** **:** The Customer Service Associate works in support of the store management team to facilitate and perform a variety of tasks including customer service, food and beverage preparation, cash register duties, general housekeeping and other related functions. The Customer Service Associate delivers an exceptional customer experience that supports Wawa’s vision to fulfill lives every day.  
**Principal Duties:**

* Greet and provide an enjoyable shopping experience for all customers. Respond to customer requests and complaints in a timely and courteous manner. Utilize the GREAT customer service and customer recovery model to ensure customer engagement.
* Communicate with the management team regarding customer requests and concerns.
* Operate the cash register, scan items, bag merchandise and properly handle different methods of payment. Maintain proper cash levels in register drawer and change machines. Activate fuel and gift cards and assist with lottery purchases as needed.
* Comply with federal and state laws by requesting personal identification from customers who are purchasing restricted products such as tobacco and/or alcohol.
* Stock and refill product within the interior and exterior core register area, cold express cases, bakery and grocery aisles.
* Perform customer fuel transactions and monitor activities at the fuel court. Stop fuel pumps if necessary.
* Prepare all made to order food and/or beverages according to recipe or customer specifications.
* Stock food and beverage areas with products and supplies to ensure in stock conditions at all times. Ensure coffee thermals are filled and working properly.
* Ensure the proper execution of assigned foodservice and beverage programs and procedures.
* Complete cleanliness tasks to ensure all food and beverage service areas are free of any residue, debris and spills.
* Follow proper coding procedures. Check expiration codes, face and inspect all items. Pull expired items, document and discard.
* Adhere to the execution of established safety, security, quality and store operations policies, procedures and practices as outlined in Wawa’s policy manual, training materials and other publications.
* Complete all store housekeeping functions (i.e., cleaning, dusting, sweeping, mopping, emptying trash, etc.).
* Ensure safe working conditions by maintaining a clean, organized work area in accordance to standards.
* Complete other tasks as assigned by store management.

**Essential Functions:**

* Ability to work well individually as well as in a team environment
* Good communication skills
* Excellent customer service skills
* Ability to learn FSRA process and procedures and demonstrate on a daily basis
* Ability to work overtime as needed
* Ability to multi-task in fast paced environment
* Ability to learn and demonstrate all Wawa Safety and Quality Assurance processes and procedures
* Must be able to perform the following physical behaviors repetitively throughout a shift: standing, walking, handling, reaching horizontally and grasping firmly
* Must be able to perform the following physical behaviors frequently throughout a shift: reaching above the shoulder, reaching below the waist, pushing buttons, bending, stooping, squatting, crouching, kneeling and pushing
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 35 lbs
* Work safely with equipment that can create and hold very high temperatures using appropriate personal protective equipment.
* Must be at least 16 years old
* Must have reliable transportation
* Must wear slip resistant shoes at all times
* Must be able to tolerate exposure to cleaning products

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Pursuit of or high school diploma or equivalent, preferred
* Prior food service and/or customer service experience preferred

Wawa will provide reasonable accommodation to complete an application upon request, consistent with applicable law. If you require an accommodation, please contact our Associate Service Center at 1-800-444-9292.  
Wawa, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Wawa maintains a work environment in which Associates are treated fairly and with respect and in which discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. In accordance with federal, state and local laws, we recruit, hire, promote and evaluate all applicants and Associates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, familial status, marital status, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, domestic or sexual violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Unlawful discrimination will not be a factor in any employment decision.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)
* Night Shift (Preferred)
* Overnight Shift (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Manager of Growth & Outreach
description:
**Description**

The Manager of Growth & Outreach spearheads the Mount Sinai Parenting Center’s efforts to scale our program to include a wide range of audiences in the healthcare space, in order to support our goal of ensuring our free resources reach healthcare providers nationwide who serve children and their families (hospitals, primary care providers, medical office managers, medical and provider training programs, nurse practitioners, and others). This is an integral member of our team who will execute and build on our marketing and outreach strategy.

Background

The Mount Sinai Parenting Center’s mission is to transform the way pediatric healthcare is delivered by maximizing opportunities to promote strong parent-child relationships and early childhood development within everyday healthcare interactions. We create trainings, curricula, videos and resources for providers to use in healthcare moments with the goal of providing parents with the tools they need to foster optimal social, emotional and cognitive development in their children 0-5 years old.

**Responsibilities**

Marketing & Outreach

* Develops and tests marketing campaigns for various audiences, including email campaigns, digital and social media marketing, and advertising
* Develops targeted marketing materials and standardized presentations to connect with different audiences in the healthcare space
* Plans and implements marketing campaigns and outreach projects to meet recruiting objectives as outlined by the Parenting Center leadership team
* Coordinates in-person and virtual events and conferences; travels locally and domestically to engage in outreach activities on behalf of the Parenting Center

Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement

* Creates and builds on relationships with external organizations in support of marketing and outreach efforts
* Builds relationships with and manages ambassadors for the Parenting Center to expand our capacity to reach audiences nationwide

Strategic Planning & Project Management

* Executes a strategy for marketing and outreach to support the Parenting Center’s goals for scale and recruitment
* Collaborates with data and operations staff to test and evaluate marketing campaigns and strategies with different audiences, track metrics, and build data-driven approaches to marketing and outreach
* Explores the needs and interests of different audiences in the healthcare space to make recommendations for the Parenting Center’s marketing and outreach strategy
* Develops and presents recommendations for new and/or improved approaches to scale and recruitment
* Works closely with data & analytics manager to track metrics for marketing and outreach and build data-driven approaches to marketing and outreach

**Minimum Qualifications** 

* Bachelor’s degree required
* 3+ years of relevant experience in sales, marketing, outreach, and/or community engagement
* Significant experience bringing products or programs to scale regionally or nationally
* Familiarity with Salesforce (or similar customer relationship management software) is required
* Exceptional written and verbal communications skills; excels at public speaking

**What we’re looking for**

* You have an outgoing personality, are a self-starter, and love connecting with new people in groups and one-on-one
* You are able to quickly understand and respond to the needs of potential users
* You enjoy finding creative and innovative solutions to new challenges, have a solutions-oriented mindset
* You are comfortable making recommendations to senior leadership to guide decision-making
* You have experience managing sales and outreach for non-profit organizations
* You have experience supporting teams and projects focused on pediatric healthcare, early childhood development, early childhood education, workforce development, and/or related fields

**Salary Range** 

$75,000 - $85,000 annually

**Application Requirements**

To apply, please submit your resume, along with a cover letter that includes the following:

* Describe your prior marketing and outreach experience, and any other experience you feel is relevant to this role.
* Explain your interest in the Parenting Center’s mission, and in this particular position.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Material Handler
description:
Step into our world of creativity and joy!  



Material Handler


Join us and celebrate the beauty of human experience. Create for happier, healthier lives, with love for nature. Together, with kindness, humility, and a spirit of adventure, we deliver food innovations, craft inspired fragrances and develop beauty and wellbeing solutions. There’s much to learn from our 79 production sites worldwide, known for their best-in-class processes and procedures. There’s many to learn from, with high-performing leaders and caring colleagues to explore ideas and ambitions with. Every day, your energy, your personality, and your determination will shape our future, making a positive difference on billions of people. Every essence of you enriches our world. We are Givaudan. Human by nature.

Your future position?
As a Material Handler, you will help to stage raw materials for production and execute all transactions in a safe, timely and accurate manner.  


Responsibilities:
Handles containers, drums, and pails of material. Operates forklifts and other powered material handling equipment. Utilizes desktop, vehicle-mounted, and hand-held computers for receiving instructions and real-time inventory updates. Maintains accurate records by use of Radio Frequency Bar Code equipment. Stage raw materials and finished goods in and out of Production as required. Some Material Handlers may be required to drive the Switcher (Yard Jockey) as the major percentage of their time. Some Material Handlers may be required to kit material for compounding as the major percentage of their time.  

  

Loads and unloads trucks. Labels and weighs containers and draws samples of food-grade ingredients. Evaluates raw materials in warehouses and production areas and submits questionable raw materials to Quality Control.  

Ensures compliance with all Federal Drug Administration (FDA) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) guidelines. Attends safety meetings and exercises constant care to prevent injury to self and others. Maintains level of housekeeping/sanitation which meets the Company’s standards and guidelines.  

  

Academic Background:
High School diploma or equivalent required, with basic math, reading and record-keeping skills. Minimum of 1-year experience in computerized warehouse and real-time data collection and valid forklift license required (can be obtained on the job). Familiarity with inventory systems, bar-coding experience preferred. Must be able to follow written and flow-charted instructions. Dependability, effective communication skills, attention to detail and commitment to providing quality and timely service are essential. Must be flexible, safety-oriented, customer-focused and willing to work overtime as needed.  


Organization Relationships:
Internal Contacts: Warehouse/ Distribution employees, Production, Manufacturing, Quality Control Purchasing.  

External: Truck Drivers  

  

Working Conditions:
Working conditions may include exposure to dust and/or fumes raw materials and finished products.  

Effect of Errors:
Improper storage of raw materials may result in product spoilage. Failure to move materials in a timely manner may result in production delays. Failure to operate equipment in a safe manner may result in injury to self or others.  

Physical Demands/ Dexterity:
Must be able to lift 50 pounds unassisted and maneuver minimum or 5-gallon pails and 55-gallon drums with proper material handling equipment. Must be able to operate material handling equipment safely and comply with GMPs.  

  

Equipment Used:
Must operate desktop, vehicle-mounted, and hand-held computers, in addition to forklift and stretch wrap machines.  

Responsibility for Work of Others:
No supervisory responsibility, but works as part of a team and must report safety violations to Lead or wrap machines.

At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people’s lives.  

You work within an inspiring teamwork culture – where you can thrive, collaborate and learn from other talented and passionate people across disciplines, regions and divisions.  

Every essence of you enriches our world.  

Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers and partners.  

Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world.
**Remote working:** On-site
company_description: Givaudan is a global leader in Fragrance & Beauty and Taste & Wellbeing. We celebrate the beauty of human experience by creating for happier, healthier lives with love for nature.

title: Audit Associate | 2024
description:
Status Category:
**Full-Time**
Exempt/Non-Exempt:
**Exempt**

**40**
Job Code:
**FS210AU**

With over 120 offices and nearly 7,000 associates throughout the U.S. CBIZ (NYSE: CBZ) delivers top-level financial and employee business services to organizations of all sizes, as well as individual clients, by providing national-caliber expertise combined with highly personalized service delivered at the local level.



CBIZ has been honored to be the recipient of several national recognitions for 2023:
* Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in the Nation
* Top Workplaces USA
* America's Best Mid-Size Employers
* Best and Brightest Companies in Wellness
* Great Place to Work Certification

  


Together, CBIZ and Mayer Hoffman McCann P.C. (MHM) are ranked as one of the top providers of accounting services in the United States. MHM is an independent CPA firm that provides audit, review and attest services, while CBIZ provides, business consulting, tax and financial services.



**Essential Functions & Primary Duties**


* Gain an understanding and assist in planning multiple audit assignments in Real Estate, Construction, Nonprofit, Manufacturing and many more industries
* Execute solid understanding of accounting and auditing principles, quality control standards and technology implementation procedures relative to individual client assignments
* Participate in client assignments from beginning to end
* Identify and communicate audit issues, technical matters and improvement opportunities with senior associates, managers, and partners to resolve client issues discovered during the audit process
* Develop and maintain an excellent working relationship with all levels of client staff to increase customer satisfaction and to strengthen client relationships
* Pledge to provide exceptional service to every client by providing individual attention, responsiveness, and commitment to understanding their goals and needs
* Maintain and comply with the highest degree of professional standards, client confidentiality, and personal conduct
* Assist with training and mentoring junior associates and interns on MHM audit methodology


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Master’s degree in Accounting, Taxation or related field preferred
* CPA eligible and/or desire to obtain certification preferred
* Internship experience in accounting or related field preferred


**Minimum Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree required
* Excellent interpersonal, analytical, research and audit project management skills, and have basic knowledge of GAAP and GAAS rules, procedures and standards
* Demonstrated ability to communicate verbally and in writing throughout all levels of organization, both internally and externally
* Ability to multi-task, think independently and problem solve in a results driven team oriented environment
* Strong verbal and written communications skills
* Strong computer and technical skills including, Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, intranet and audit software
* Must be able to travel based on client and business needs


**Compensation**



The annual salary target for this job in this market is $69,000-$73,000. The specific compensation for this role will be determined based on education, experience and skill set of the individual selected for this position. The compensation above is not representative of an employee’s total compensation. Beyond income, you have access to: comprehensive medical and dental insurance, retirement savings, life and disability insurance, health care and dependent care reimbursement accounts, certification incentives, education assistance, referral program and much more.

  


CBIZ.Jobs Category: University

You can request a reasonable accommodation by calling 844-558-1414 (toll free) or send an email to accom@cbiz.com.

title: Spanish Instructor for kids grades pre-k September and on (UES)
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $75 per class. It's about a 1 hour 20 minute commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contactor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occassionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for Spanish Immersion**

Designed for young students, Spanish Immersion teaches conversational and basic Spanish language using Total Physical Response (TPR)- a "learn by doing" approach. Every activity has students speaking, listening, acting and learning, and is enriched by studies of Spanish and Latin American cultures!

This class comes with curriculum.

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $50 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

**Dates for the class:** 9/26/24 - 12/12/24

**Times:** 2:45pm- 3:25pm

**Grades:** prek-k

**Neighborhood:** Upper East Side (E. 70's)

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

As of right now we are actively hiring for: Cartoon animation and comics creation, piano, guitar, chess, programmable robots, yoga, LEGO, Sportsworld, ninja academy and dinoworld.

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Required)
* Experience with children: 1 year (Required)
* Classroom management: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person
